1.content:
To most people at Griffin Community Hospital, Margo Dietrich appeared to be your average 24-year-old woman. A tall, attractive, brunette; Margo had been working at the hospital for the last 3 months in the Pediatrics Wing. However, looks can be very deceiving; Margo Dietrich wasn’t even human. She was born Sorain Kekeva on the planet Maltor Prime – a member of the Maltorian species..

She and 7 other Maltorians arrived on Earth 13 months earlier to observe the dominant species – Terrans. Every member of the team was genetically altered to appear human, given a Human identity and left on the planet.

It was 3:45 on a Friday afternoon and Margo was anxiously waiting for her shift to end. Far from having a bad day, Margo had plans tonight – a co-worker had set her up on a blind date this evening. There was just one last thing Margo needed to do before she left, and it was a task she didn’t take lightly.

Margo walked down the hall and entered Room #415 to find her favorite patient, 7-year-old David Collins, lying in bed. David had been in the hospital for almost 2 weeks following complications from appendicitis. He reminded Margo a lot of her at that age; a keen curiosity about almost anything.

“Hello David, how are you feeling today?”

“I’m feeling a lot better, Nurse Margo.” Smiling, David said, “I can’t wait to go home tomorrow.”

“Your parents called while you were napping; they said to tell you that they’ll be here tomorrow around noon to bring you home.”

David’s parents had to fly out west for a funeral following a sudden death in the family. David’s condition meant that, unfortunately, he had to stay behind. Margo had promised his folks that she would look after him while they were gone.
Hearing his parents were coming home put a smile on David’s face. Looking at Margo, he said, “I’m really going to miss you, Margo.”

“I’m going to miss you too, sweetie.” Giving David’s hand an affectionate squeeze, Margo said, “You’ve been so strong and brave; I wish more of my patients were like you.”

“It’s almost time for my cartoons.” Smiling, David said, “You want to stay and watch them with me?”

“I wish I could, but I’ve got plans tonight.”

“Oh, okay.” Trying to hide his disappointment, David said, “Have fun.”

“I’ll see you tomorrow, kiddo.”
1.title: The Beginning

11.content:
It was just before 4:45 when Margo stepped out of the shower. As she wrapped a towel around herself, Margo walked out of the bathroom and closed the curtains in her bedroom. Once that was finished, she walked over to her desk and pulled out a small circular device; similar in appearance to what the Terrans referred to as an Alexa. Placing it on the desk, she went over to the closet and retrieved a dress.

“Begin Log Entry – Day 413.”

Dropping the towel to the floor, Margo started to get into the dress. “It has been my observation that Terran women typically signal their desire to mate by wearing clothing that reveals some, but not all, of their secondary sex characteristics.” Glancing at her reflection in the mirror, satisfied by what she saw, she continued, “What is considered to be too much is still a matter for debate; I can only hope that I have guessed correctly.”

Walking into the bathroom, Margo proceeded to do her hair and makeup; as she had become accustomed to doing since her arrival. It had taken her some time to get used to her hair, as Maltorians are naturally bald. As she started on her makeup, she said, “Having had little success in attracting a mate by myself, I have agreed to a co-worker’s offer to ‘fix me up’ with a woman of her acquaintance.” Putting on some lipstick, Margo said, “This offer appears to be a common occurrence among Terrans, so I run little risk of revealing too much about myself by accepting.”

Suddenly Margo was interrupted by an alert from her phone. Walking out of the bathroom, she saw it was a text from Liz – the woman she’d been set up with. Grabbing her phone, she read the text:

“I can’t wait to meet you; Megan’s told me all about you.”

Sitting down on the bed, Margo said, “As I prepare to leave for my ‘blind date,’ as these assignations are known, I can’t help but imagine Dhelo’s reaction if she were to learn about tonight.” Sighing, as she put on her boots, Margo said, “She was suspicious of my motives for taking this assignment; no doubt discovering that I was planning sexual congress with a Terran woman would only serve to confirm them.”

Seeing what time it was, and satisfied that she was ready, Margo grabbed her purse. As she walked out of the bedroom, she said, “End Log Entry.”

**********************


Margo parked her car in front of the restaurant 20 minutes later. After checking to make sure she had everything, Margo went inside the restaurant. Shortly after stepping inside, she received a text notification on her phone. Looking at it, she saw it was Liz again:

“I’m running a few minutes late; why don’t you grab a table and I’ll be there soon.”

As she walked over to the hostess, Margo started to worry whether Liz was actually going to show up at all. She’d heard stories from co-workers about being ‘stood up’ on dates. While she hadn’t experienced that yet, Margo knew it was a possibility. Putting a smile on her face, Margo looked at the hostess and said, “I’d like a table for two please; preferably in a quiet area.”

Margo followed the hostess through the restaurant and sat down in a booth in the corner. Placing the menus on the table, the hostess said, “Your server will be around shortly, is there anything else I can do for you?”

“Yes, actually, there is.” Pausing, Margo said, “I’m meeting someone; when they arrive, can you tell them where I am?”

“Of course.”

**********************


10 minutes had passed since Margo sat down at the table, and Liz hadn’t shown up yet. She passed the time by drinking her beer and observing her fellow restaurant-goers. She liked to frequent places such as this; places that would give her the best opportunity to see Terrans in a social setting. In many ways, she realized, they weren’t that different from Maltorians. Of course, Terrans were a few centuries behind technologically but socially the two species were pretty similar.

Margo was brought back to reality by the sound of someone clearing their throat. Looking up, she saw an attractive looking brunette standing on the opposite end of the table. A smile on her face, the brunette said, “Are you Margo?”

“That depends.” With a quizzical smile, Margo said, “Are you Liz?”

“I am Liz.” Reaching her hand out, Liz said, “It’s nice to finally meet you; Megan’s told me all about you.”

Believe me, she hasn’t. Shaking the offered hand, Margo said, “It’s nice to meet you too; I’ll be honest; when I saw you were going to be late, I thought you might stand me up.”

“I’d never do that.” Sitting down, with a chuckle, Liz said, “Besides, Megan wouldn’t let me hear the end of it if I did.”

“I hope you don’t mind if I started drinking without you.”

“That’s alright.” Pausing, Liz said, “So Megan tells me you just moved out here a few months ago?”

Margo had spent the first 7 months on Earth living out in California; but it was too crowded for her, so she decided to relocate to a small town. “That’s right.” Sighing, Margo said, “I’d just gotten out of a pretty serious relationship, and I wanted to get away.”

“I can understand that.” Looking at Margo, Liz said, “With my track record, I was starting to wonder if the girl for me was even on this planet.”

You are more right than you know.
11.title: Date Night

111.content:
The date ended up going better than Margo had expected; as she realized there was definitely something about Liz that she liked. They spent most of the date getting to know each other; Margo found out that Liz worked as an elementary school teacher.

After leaving the restaurant, Liz turned to Margo and said, “You feel like coming back to my place?” with a hopeful smile, Liz said, “We can have a few drinks and maybe see where the evening takes us?”

Margo quickly realized what Liz was implying, and it surprised her. It had been her experience that Terrans typically frowned upon having sex on the first date. The opposite was true for Maltorians; who always slept with a prospective mate on the first date. With a smile, Margo said, “Sure, I don’t see why not.”

**************************


You can imagine their surprise when Margo and Liz realized they lived in the same apartment complex; in fact, their buildings were only four down from each other. After parking her car in front of her building, Margo walked down to meet Liz outsider her building. As they walked up the steps, Liz said, “I hope you don’t mind the clutter in my living room, I’ve got a bunch of dioramas to grade.”

“That’s okay.” With a mischievous smile, Margo said, “I don’t think we’ll be spending much time in the living room.”

Things started happening not long after they arrived at Liz’s apartment. Thanks to an inhibitor she’d taken before the date, Margo was unaffected by the copious amount of alcohol that she and Liz consumed – but she did have to act as though she were. Things eventually moved to the bedroom where the two made love to each other for almost an hour.

As the two of them lay in bed together, looking at each other with smiles on their faces, Liz said, “That was the best sex I’ve had in a long time.”

Margo knew that Terrans didn’t like being compared to someone previous mate; but she had to admit that Liz was, in some ways, better in bed than Dhelo. “I hope you don’t think less of me for putting out on the first date.”

“Oh please, you’re fine.” Chuckling, Liz said, “I wouldn’t have suggested it if I thought it would be a problem.”

“It’s nice to meet someone who shares that belief.” Looking at Liz, Margo said, “I have to make sure I thank Megan for introducing us.”

The two of them lay in bed together, listening as a light rain hit the window. The silence was soon interrupted by the sound of a ringing cell phone. Once Margo realized it was her phone, she got up and dug it out of her purse. Her post-sex euphoria was short-lived when she saw it was a text from Kevin Anderson. That, of course, was his cover ID; his real name was Tervin Dejora – he was another member of the observation team. It didn’t help that the text was just two words – Code Red.

Per the mission guidelines, Code Red was only to be used in the most extreme circumstances. Of course, the arrival of the text meant Margo’s evening was over. Taking a deep breath, Margo turned back to look at Liz in bed. “I’m really sorry about this, but a family emergency has come up.”

“There’s no need to apologize.” Sitting up in bed, Liz said, “I hope everything is alright.”

I hope so too, but I doubt it. “I’m sure it’s nothing serious.” Grabbing her clothes from the floor, Margo said, “Do you have plans this weekend?”

“Not really.” Smiling, Liz said, “Are you asking me out on a second date?”

“I really enjoyed the first one, and the sex was amazing.” Chuckling, Margo said, “I’d love to see where things go from here.”

“I’ll text you in the morning.”

*****************************


It was a quick 5-minute walk back to Margo’s apartment. Walking into the bedroom, she closed the curtains and pulled a small tablet from the desk. After inputting a code, she waited for a response – which came in the form of a scruffy looking male in his early 20s. “This better be important, Tervin.”

“It’s very important, Sorain.” Taking a breath, Khals said, “The satellite we placed in orbit has detected an incoming energy signature.”

“Energy signature?” confused, Margo said, “Is it the retrieval team? I thought we had another 3 months?”

“It’s not the retrieval team.” Pausing, Khals said, “The energy signature is Creelaxian.”

Margo went pale when she heard that. “How long we do we have?”

“They should arrive in orbit within the hour.”
“What’s the plan?”

“Make your way to the rendezvous point.”

“I’ll be there as soon as I can.”
111.title: After the Restaurant

1111.content:
Meanwhile, across town, 14-year-old Olivia Sheppard was home alone while her brother Eric was at work. Where are her parents you ask? Well, they were sadly killed in a car accident when Olivia was 7 years old; she’d been in the car with them, but she survived with only a broken arm and a mild concussion. Rather than let her end up in the system Eric, who had just turned 18, became her legal guardian.

It was getting close to 9:00 and Olivia knew Eric was going to be home soon. She was sitting in her room texting with her best friend Emily.

I don’t understand why Eric hates Kyle so much.


Maybe it’s because he’s 19 years old and you’re only 14.

I’m surprised Eric hasn’t done anything to Kyle yet.

Girl, why do you have to take Eric’s side?


I’m not taking Eric’s side, I’m just trying to help you.

What if Kyle tries to take advantage of you or something?

Just then Olivia saw the reflection of headlights move across her wall – someone was pulling into the driveway.

I g2g, Eric’s home.

I’ll ttyl


Without waiting to see Emily’s response, Olivia walked downstairs to the door. Opening the door, expecting to see Eric, she was surprised to see Kyle standing there. “Kyle, what are you doing here?”

“Hey babe, I just got off work and thought we could hang out.”

“I’d love to, but my brother is going to be home soon.” Sighing, Olivia said, “He’s still upset with you for drinking his beer.”

“Whatever.” Walking into the house, Kyle said, “I haven’t seen you in a few days; I thought maybe we could go up to your room or something.”

Olivia was starting to feel uneasy at this point; Kyle wasn’t usually this pushy. “I-I don’t know, Kyle.”

“Come on, babe!” groaning, Kyle said, “We’ve been dating for 2 months and we haven’t even had sex yet.”

What if Emily is right? “I told you, I’m not ready.”

Grabbing Olivia’s hand, Kyle said, “Come on, what if we just make out on your bed.”

Unsure what to do, and feeling uneasy, Olivia silently closed the door and followed Kyle upstairs.

*********************************


It was just after 9:20 when Eric Sheppard got home from work. Having just gotten off a long day at work, he was looking forward to relaxing and watching a movie with Olivia. Pulling into the driveway, he groaned when he saw the familiar car of Kyle Wilcox – Olivia’s 19-year-old boyfriend.

Great, what’s that asshole doing here?

After parking the car in the garage, Eric entered the house; only to find no sign of Olivia or Kyle anywhere. He was about to call Olivia’s name when he heard her voice from upstairs. “Stop Kyle, I said no!”

Without hesitating, Eric ran upstairs to Olivia’s room; bursting into the room to find Olivia and Kyle on the bed, with Kyle’s hands groping Olivia’s chest. “What the hell!” pulling Kyle away from Olivia, Eric said, “Get away from her!”

Olivia got up and stood behind Eric; a nervous expression on her face. Looking at him, she said, “He came by a few minutes ago; I didn’t think he should be here, but he came in anyway.”

Casting a quick glance to Olivia, Eric saw she was starting to tear up. Turning his attention to Kyle, he said, “You must be the dumbest person in the world; I’m a cop and you’re here trying to take advantage of my sister!”

“Look, man, I don’t know what you think is going on here.”

“I know exactly what’s going on here.” Still in his uniform, Eric retrieved his handcuffs and said, “I’m taking you in, you son of a bitch.”

Before Eric could take one step towards him, Kyle made a fist and punched him in the nose. Staggering from the unexpected punch, Eric watched as Kyle grabbed Olivia and pulled her out of the room. Regaining his balance, Eric ran down the stairs after them; listening as Olivia pleaded with Kyle to stop.

Eric managed to get outside just as Kyle’s car peeled out of the driveway. As he ran to his car, Eric remembered a promise he made to his parents when Olivia was born – that he would always do everything he could to keep her safe.

Driving down the street, Eric grabbed his police scanner and said, “This is Officer Sheppard; be on the lookout for a 2016 silver F150, license plate 327-XDC.” Turning onto the main road, I said, “Driver has assaulted an officer and taken a minor against her will.”
1111.title: Boyfriend Troubles

11111.content:
Kyle was speeding down Main Street as Olivia screamed at him from the passenger seat. “Stop this car right now, Kyle!”

“Not a chance, babe.” Turning to Olivia as he drove down the street, Kyle said, “We’re not stopping until we get to my place.”

“My brother’s a cop, dummy; he can find out where you live!”

Kyle realized that Olivia was right; it would be long before her asshole brother was breaking down his door. “Okay; then we’ll go to a hotel or something.” Pausing, Kyle said, “Either way, we’re going past 1st base tonight.”

“You’re crazy if you think I’m going to sleep with you after what you did.” Glaring at Kyle, Olivia said, “First you assault my brother and then you abduct me. God, Emily was right; I never should have gotten together with you.”

By that point, Kyle had driven them both to the outskirts of town. Pulling over along the road overlooking the dam, he turned to Olivia and said, “Please, you were practically begging me to ask you out.”

“You can consider this my dumping you.” Getting out of the car, Olivia turned to look at Kyle and said, “I never want to see you again.”

Kyle was about to say something he was interrupted by a loud roaring noise coming from overhead. Suddenly the surrounding area lit up like daylight as a flaming object flew past overhead; crashing in the hills on the other side of the dam. Forgetting the argument with Olivia, he turned to her and said, “What was that?”

“I don’t know.”

“Get in, let’s go check it out.”

A part of Olivia realized getting back into the car was a bad idea, but another part of her wanted to see what it was that crashed. As Kyle drove down towards the access road, Olivia got her phone out and called Eric.
11111.title: Fleeing the House

111111.content:
Eric was approaching the outskirts of town when he saw a bright object fly by overhead. It looked like it was going in the direction of the dam, so he decided to head that way. As he drove down the road, his cell phone started to ring. Seeing it was Olivia, he answered it and said, “Olivia! Where are you?”

“We’re up by the dam; something crashed nearby and we’re checking it out.”

“Don’t do anything until I get there, I’ll be there in a few minutes.”

**********************************


It turned out to be an almost 10-minute drive to the damn. Driving through the damaged gate blocking the access road, Eric drove about ½ a mile before he saw Olivia standing on the side of the road. As soon as Eric got out of the car, Olivia ran over to him in tears. Hugging him, she said, “I’m so sorry Eric.”

“It’s okay, O.” looking at her, I said, “Where’s Kyle?”

Pointing towards a glow in the distance, Olivia said, “He went to check out what crashed.” Looking at Eric, Olivia said, “I-I have no idea what it is.”

After retrieving his gun from the car, in case Kyle tried anything funny, Eric followed Olivia through the woods to the clearing. Once in the clearing, Eric could tell why Olivia had no idea what the object was – as even he’d never seen anything like it before. Whatever it was, it was shaped like an oval and was probably around 12 feet tall.

Eric was so entranced by the object that he briefly forgot why he was here. That was until he caught sight of Kyle near the far end of the object. Running up to him, Eric grabbed him by the collar and said, “I ought to beat the shit out of you.”

“Whatever man; it’s not like I did anything wrong.”

“Really, smart guy?” shoving him, Eric said, “First you assaulted a minor, then you assaulted police officer followed by abducting said minor.”

Before Kyle could respond, he was interrupted by a low humming noise. The noise got louder until an opening into the object appeared behind Kyle. Looking at the opening, he said, “What the hell is going on here?”

Grabbing his phone, Eric said, “I’m calling this in.” he was about to dial his chief’s number when he saw Kyle walk through the opening. “Don’t go inside, you idiot!”

But that didn’t stop Kyle from continuing inside; Eric had to keep Olivia from going inside after him. Instead, she stood behind Eric and yelled out, “Kyle, come back!”

Suddenly there was a loud noise from inside the object; almost if something had slammed shut. After a moment, Olivia and Eric heard banging and what sounded like Kyle calling for help. Olivia started towards the opening, but Eric stopped her and said, “I’ll go in and check it out.”

While Olivia stayed outside, Eric went through the opening and found himself in the strangest place he’d ever been in. There were several consoles and what looked like pipes, all leading to a hollow tube in the middle of the room – with Kyle inside.

As Eric walked towards the tube, he could hear Kyle’s muffled attempts to speak. “Get me out of here!”

“I’ll see what I can do.” checking around the tube, Eric said, “Next time how about you don’t go inside the strange object.”

Looking around the room, Eric couldn’t find anything of use to him; everything seemed to have some strange writing on it. What the hell is this place?

Suddenly there were footsteps behind him, Eric turned around to find Olivia walking over to the tube. “Kyle, are you alright?”

“I don’t know; just get me out of here!”

Suddenly the room filled with the sound of distant rumbling. Olivia and Eric could only watch as some strange gas started seeping into the chamber; followed by Kyle suddenly doubling over in pain.
111111.title: The Call (Eric's POV)

1111111.content:
Olivia and Eric were momentarily unable to do anything as confusion set in. Suddenly Eric found the urge to beat the shit out of Kyle being replaced with the urge to get him out of the tube. While Eric started looking for a way to get Kyle out, he turned to Olivia and said, “O, find something to break the glass.”

But she didn’t move; instead, she just stood there in front of the tube, mesmerized but what was happening inside. Whatever the gas was that was entering the chamber, it was having a shocking effect on Kyle – it was changing him.

The first notable change that Eric and Olivia saw was Kyle’s skin changing from its normal white color to dark green. It wasn’t that the skin color was changing; the skin itself was also changing, as scales appeared on his body. Slamming a hand on the glass, struggling to fight the pain, Kyle said, “G-Get m-me out o-of here!”

Taking his gun out, Eric fired a few shots at the tube; only to find whatever it was made of to be bulletproof. While Eric went back to searching for something to break the chamber, Olivia did what she could to keep Kyle’s spirits up, “Don’t worry, we’ll get you out of there!”

By this time almost 90% of Kyle’s body was covered in scales; with the changes now progressing to his face. The changes reminded me of those cheesy transformation scenes in old movies; as Kyle’s face slowly changed to resemble a canine snout. Another shocking change was the sudden appearance of a second, slightly smaller, set of eyes.

At this point, Eric gave up searching because he was too engrossed by what was happening in the tube. By this point, Kyle’s screams of pain had turned into guttural, almost primal, growls.

Suddenly Kyle fell to his knees, as a series of cracking noises escaped the chamber. Eric and Olivia could only watch in silent horror as Kyle’s legs bent themselves into an impossible position. While this was happening, Kyle’s feet and hands changed into paws; each with 3 sharp claws protruding from them. Eric quickly realized that, by this point, the Kyle they knew no longer existed – having been replaced by a large, scaly, quadrupedal creature. Unfortunately, the changes didn’t stop there; the creature’s back started to bubble up; as a series of sharp spines burst out of its skin.

What was left of the gas soon dissipated, which gave Eric and Olivia a clear image of the creature inside the chamber. It looked to be about the size of a large bulldog; with a mouth full of razor-sharp teeth. It must’ve sensed there were in the room because suddenly it started growling and clawing at the door.

Suddenly, without warning, the chamber door opened. Before Eric could stop her, Olivia stepped closer to the creature. Reaching her hand out, she said, “K-Kyle, are you in there?”

Olivia got an answer, just not the one she wanted, when the creature lunged at her. Before she knew what was happening, the creature had latched onto Olivia’s arm. Hearing Olivia’s screams caused Eric to spring into action; as he went about trying to save his sister. Eric went behind the creature and tried to pull it off Olivia, but that only served to make it angry.

The creature released its grip on Olivia and turned its attention to Eric; as Olivia slowly tried to get away from it. It wasn’t long before Eric was on his back trying to keep the creature from biting him. The room was suddenly filled with the sound of gunfire; followed by the creature’s pained cries.

Looking around Eric saw Olivia aiming his gun at the creature. In pain, but still able to fight, the creature lunged towards Olivia; only for her to finally kill it with a shot to the head.

Getting up from the floor, Eric made his way over to Olivia as she collapsed to the floor in shock. He quickly went about making a tourniquet for Olivia’s badly mangled arm. Once that was taken care of, the two of them just stared at the creature lying in a pool of blood on the floor – wondering what could have turned a human being into something like that.
1111111.title: A Horrifying Development

choices: Back at the Crash Site (Olivia & Eric's POV)
Arriving Back at the Hospital (Margo's POV)
11111111.content:
Margo was about 10 miles outside of town when she saw the fireball overhead. She immediately pulled off to the side of the road before stepping out of the car to look back in the direction of town. She had less than 2 hours to get to the rendezvous point, after which she’d leave Earth. But she was having second thoughts about fleeing; thinking about what fates might befall David and Liz.

Humanity wasn’t prepared to fend off a Creel invasion; her species was on par technologically with them, but they still managed to conquer Maltor Prime in a matter of days. As she stood there, leaning against her car, Margo wondered what she should do.

After a few minutes of silence, she made her decision; she was going to return and help. As she got back into the car, she was determined not to let what happened to her planet happen to Earth. Before turning the car around, she dug through her bags until she found what she was looking for – a futuristic-looking gun.
11111111.title: Having Second Thoughts

111111111.content:
Meanwhile, back the crash site, it seemed to take forever for the EMTs and backup to arrive on the scene. Eric had moved Olivia outside of the pod and leaned her up against the hull. Looking at her, he said, “How are you feeling?”

“My arm is killing me, Eric.” Sighing, Olivia said, “But it looks like the bleeding has slowed down.”

At that moment, Eric spotted the flashing lights of an ambulance in the distance. Getting up, he looked at Olivia and said, “Stay here, I’ll be right back.”

Eric ran through the woods back to the road; arriving just as several patrol cars arrived behind the ambulance. Running up to one of the EMTs, Eric said, “My sister is in the clearing nearby, and her arm is pretty torn up.”

As the EMTs started running towards the clearing, Eric was approached by the last person he wanted to see. Adam Williams was another officer in the department; for some reason he never particularly liked Eric, and the feeling was mutual. “Have you been drinking, Sheppard?” looking at Eric, he said, “That’s the only explanation I can think of for your outrageous report.”

“No Williams, I haven’t been drinking.” Sighing, Eric said, “My sister’s boyfriend got turned into some strange creature and subsequently attacked her.”

“Are you sure it wasn’t a wolf that attacked your sister?”

Sensing the derisive tone of William’s voice, Eric said, “Listen here, Williams; I know what I saw.”

“Well, I guess I’ll just have to see for myself.”

Eric followed Williams through the woods to the clearing; arriving as the EMTs were loading Olivia onto a gurney. Seeing Eric, one of them walked over and said, “Your sister’s lost a lot of blood, we need to take her to the hospital.”
Nodding in acknowledgment, Eric walked over to Olivia and said, “I’ll be right behind you; I just want to make sure everything is good here.”

“Don’t take too long.”

After the EMTs left with Olivia, Eric walked over to the pod entrance where Williams was standing. He arrived just as the creature was being removed; turning just in time to see William’s face turn to one of horror. “That’s no wolf.”

“That’s what I was trying to tell you, Williams.” Gesturing to the creature as it was carried past, I Eric said, “That thing used to be my sister’s boyfriend.”

Suddenly the clearing was awash with light; as a series of helicopters suddenly appeared overhead. Before Eric could ask what was going on, he saw half a dozen soldiers come out of the woods and into the clearing. They made their way over to where everyone was standing. One of the soldiers, an older man, said, “I’m Colonel Jackson; I have to ask that you all leave the area immediately.” Pausing, he said, “This is now a government operation, your presence is not required.”

Eric wanted to argue with the man but thought better of it. Turning to the other cops, as the ranking officer on the scene, Eric said, “You heard the man, everyone leave the area.”

Eric followed everyone out of the clearing; as helicopters started landing more troops to cordon off the area. He didn’t have time to think about that now; because his chief concern was going to the hospital to check on Olivia.
111111111.title: Back at the Crash Site

1111111111.content:
It was just after midnight when Eric arrived at the Hospital. Running into the ER, he went up to the nurse and asked for Olivia’s location. Having expected her to be in the ER, he was surprised to find that she was instead upstairs in the ICU.

Heading to the elevator, he frantically pressed the call button; cursing the elevator for taking so long. At that moment he noticed a cute red-head come up next to him. Getting a look at her, he noticed she appeared to be on edge about something. “Are you alright, ma’am?”

“No, not really.” Turning to Eric, the red-head said, “I received some bad news earlier, and I just want to make sure one of my patients is alright.”

“Patients?” pausing, Eric said, “Are you a doctor?”

“No, I’m a nurse.” With a forced smile, the red-head said, “My name’s Margo.”

“I’m Eric.” Getting impatient, he said, “I just wish this damn elevator would move quicker.”

“I suppose I should ask if you are alright.”

The elevator arrived at that moment; with Margo and Eric rushing to get inside. After pressing the buttons for their respective floors, Eric turned to Margo and said, “My sister is in the ICU; she was attacked by some...creature in the woods. It was like nothing I’ve ever seen before.”

Eric noticed a peculiar expression on Margo’s face but the elevator arrived at her floor before he could say anything. Stepping out of the elevator, Margo turned around and said, “I hope your sister is alright.”

“Thanks, I hope your patient is alright too.”
1111111111.title: At the Hospital

11111111111.content:
Eric practically ran down the hall to Olivia’s room after getting out of the elevator; walking in to find several nurses and a doctor standing over her. He noticed several IVs in her arm and a few discarded bloody rags on a nearby tray. One of the nurses must’ve sensed Eric as in the room, because she looked up and said, “Sir, you can't be in here."

"The hell I can't, that’s my little sister!”

“My apologies, sir.” Backing off, the nurse said, “Please just stay in the corner while we finish.”

Eric stood in the corner of the room; getting a look at Olivia’s face. She looked pretty pale from the blood loss, but she managed to crack a small smile when she saw him standing there. Once the doctor and nurses were finished, the nurses left the room while the doctor stayed behind. “I’m Dr. Samson.” Looking at Eric, he said, “I understand your sister was attacked by an animal? Do you know what kind it was?”

“No, I don't.” after what he’d gone through with Williams, Eric wasn’t sure he should go into a lot of detail. Looking at the doctor, he said, “I've never seen anything like it in my life."

"Whatever the creature was, it caused massive damage to your daughter's arm. It's a miracle she didn't bleed out." Looking at the clipboard, he said, "Her blood work shows that she's fighting an infection; which we're administering antibiotics to combat it, we should know in the morning if it's successful.”

“Thank you, doctor.”

Eric watched as the doctor left the room, closing the door behind him. Once he was certain they were alone, Eric went over to Olivia’s bedside. Taking her hand, he said, “Hey O, it’s me.”

The painkillers they had Olivia on must’ve made her pretty out of it. Looking at Eric, she flashed a weak smile and said, “Hey big brother.”

Kissing Olivia’s hand, Eric said, “How are you feeling?”

“I’m feeling pretty good; although that’s probably from the drugs.” Taking a breath, Olivia said, “Where’s Kyle? Is he alright?”

Eric wasn’t sure if Olivia had short term amnesia or what, but he didn’t have the heart to tell her the truth in her current condition. With a heavy sigh, he said, “He’s down the hall, O; he’s fine.”

The drugs took effect a few minutes later, and Olivia fell asleep.
11111111111.title: Olivia's Room

111111111111.content:
Upstairs in the Pediatrics Wing, Margo was carefully making her way down the hall to David’s room. While she knew in her heart she was doing to the right thing, Margo couldn’t help but worry about the consequences if she was caught – after all, she was technically kidnapping a child from the hospital.

Walking into David’s room, she saw that he was fast asleep in bed. He has no idea his world is about to change forever. Grabbing his Batman backpack from a nearby chair, Margo started filling it with clothes from the small dresser against the wall.

Despite her best efforts to make as little noise as possible, David still woke up while she was packing his clothes. Sitting up, he rubbed his eyes and said, “Nurse Margo?”

“Hi there, sweetie.” Putting the backpack down, Margo went over to David’s bed and said, “How would you like to go on a little adventure?”

“Okay.” Still sleepy, David said, “Where are we going?”

That was one part of the plan Margo was still trying to figure out. She had just over an hour, at this point, to make her way to the rescue pod at the rendezvous, and she still had to get Liz. Looking at David, trying her best to sound reassuring, Margo said, “We’re going to someplace fun, how’s that sound?”

“Will my parents be there?”

Margo knew the likelihood that David’s parents would survive almost zero, but she knew better than to tell him that. “Of course they will, sweetie.” Putting the backpack on her back, Margo reached towards David and said, “Now come on, we have to go.”
David quickly climbed up into Margo’s arms and held on as she left the room. As they made their way to the exit, Margo was surprised when no one tried to stop her from taking David. Little did she know; everyone was in the break room listening to a news report about a series of fireballs in the sky.

The elevator ride to the lobby seemed to take forever, but they eventually reached the lobby. Margo thought she was home free until she heard “Code Purple” come over the hospital PA system. Margo figured someone must’ve gone to check on David, only to find him missing. She knew it was only a matter of time before security found her. “Margo?” Looking up at her, David said, “What’s going on?”

Running down the hall to the ER, Margo said, “Don’t worry sweetie, everything’s fine.” Taking a deep breath, Margo said, “Whatever happens next, just know that it’s all to keep you safe.”

As soon as Margo ran around the corner, she stopped in her tracks at the sight of a security guard blocking her path to the exit. He suddenly turned around and saw Margo standing there with David. “Freeze!” raising his gun, the officer said, “Let the kid go, ma’am.”

David was starting to get frightened, Margo could hear him whimpering. I’m not going to let this child suffer at the hands of the Creel. Reaching her free hand around to her back, she grabbed her gun and pulled it from her belt. After ensuring that it was set to stun, she raised it and aimed it at the officer. “This child’s life is in danger; I have to get him to safety.”

“Put the gun down, ma’am; or I will open fire.”

Combat training was required for all Maltorians between the ages of 13 and 18; Margo had a reputation in her training group for being the best shot. “Trust me; you don’t want to do that.”

Suddenly the room filled with a rumbling noise filled the room; followed by a series of distant explosions. Turning around, the guard said, “What the hell is that?”

Seeing her chance, Margo shot the guard and watched as he dropped to the floor. Running past the fallen guard, she stopped in her tracks when she saw an explosion in the parking lot. Oh no, I’m too late.

David was screaming in fear at this point. With her escape route cut off, Margo turned and ran back the way she came. Having an understanding of Creel battle tactics, Margo knew it wouldn’t be long before they swarmed the hospital looking to capture anyone they could. As she tried to find a place to hide, she looked down at David and said, “Sweetie, everything is going to be alright. I promise.”
111111111111.title: A Desperate Attempt to Escape

choices: Early The Next Morning (Olivia & Eric's POV)
1111111111111.content:
Meanwhile, back at the apartment complex, Liz was sound asleep in bed; having gone back to sleep a short time after Margo left. That was, however, until a loud rumbling sound from outside woke her up. Getting out of bed, grumbling, Liz walked over to her bedroom window. Damn kids blaring their car stereos in the middle of the night.

Opening her curtain, Liz was surprised to find not a group rowdy teens but a strange object landing in the grass across from her building. “What the hell is that?”

Her confusion turned to horror when she saw some strange looking creatures, both bipedal and quadrupedal, come out of an opening in the object. She brought a hand to her mouth in shock; as she watched the creatures venture out into the complex. She watched helplessly as one of them pulled a pregnant woman from her car; while another threw something inside that caused the car to fill with smoke. She didn’t know who was in the car with the pregnant woman but, seconds later, two of the quadrupedal creatures burst out.

The sight of that was enough for Liz to close her curtain and run into the bathroom. She closed the door just as her front door was torn open. Looking for anything she could use as a weapon, she was as silent as she could possibly be. The sound of footsteps told her something was in her bedroom.

Liz thought she was in the clear until an explosion outside caused her to scream in terror – which was enough for the creature to burst into the bathroom. This gave Liz her first up-close look at one of the bipedal creatures – a massive creature of over 6 feet in height; with dark green scales, sharp claws on the hands and feet and a series of horns above the nose. Liz struggled in vain to keep away from the creature, but it grabbed her and carried her out of the apartment and towards the object in the parking lot.
1111111111111.title: Damn Kids

11111111111111.content:
Eric’s first reaction when he woke up was confusion – as he found he wasn’t in his bedroom. This isn't my bedroom. Where am I?

Suddenly the events of last night flashed in his mind and he realized he was in the hospital.Adrenaline must have taken me as far as it could, he thought. Then I crashed.

Eric had a vague memory of falling asleep in a chair in the ICU waiting room. Sitting up in the chair, a crick in his neck, he decided to go check on Olivia.

Eric went to the door; only to find that it was blocked on the other side by a shelf on wheels. What the hell is going on here?

After pushing the heavy shelf out of the way, Eric made his way down to Olivia's room - only then realizing how quiet the floor was. It was the ICU, it should have been abuzz with activity but there was no one in sight.

Eric rounded the corner leading to Olivia's room; finding that it too was blocked. Eric wondered why someone would go to the effort to keep Olivia and him in their rooms; until it dawned on him - what if they were keeping something out.

It took some effort to move the portable x-ray machine from the doorway, but Eric eventually made it into Olivia’s room. Even standing in the doorway, Eric could tell something was wrong - Olivia looked paler than she had when they got to the hospital.

Despite his attempts to stay quiet, Olivia started to stir. Slowly opening her eyes, she said, “Eric? What’s going on?”

“You’re in the hospital, O; you were attacked last night...by Kyle.”

“What?” shocked, Olivia said, “Is he alright?”

Eric had made a promise years ago that he would never lie to Olivia; even if it put him into an awkward position. Taking a breath, he recounted the events of last night. When he was finished, he said, “I’m not sure what happened after we got here; but the military had cordoned off the area around the pod.”

“I-I can’t believe Kyle’s dead.”

“I can’t say that I particularly liked the guy, but no one deserves to go through what he did.”

Suddenly a rumbling sound could be heard permeating through the building. Looking at Eric, Olivia said, “What’s that?”

“I don’t know, O; but it might explain why the ICU is abandoned.” Grabbing his gun from his jacket, Eric said, “Stay here, I’m going to go look around.”

“I’m lying in bed with god knows how many IVs in my arm.” Raising an eyebrow to Eric, Olivia said, “Where exactly am I supposed to go?”

“It’s good to see you still have your sarcasm.”

After making sure that Olivia was safe, Eric left to investigate the noise and see if he could find anyone else in the building.
Checking every room as he went along, Eric eventually made it out of the ICU and over to the elevator lobby. Hearing the rumbling noise again, he went to a nearby window; to find a large alien craft landing near the entrance to the ER.

Curiosity got the better of him as Eric decided to go in the direction of ER. But he quickly found obstacles in his path - in the form of non-functioning elevators. He decided to take the stairs down but found the way blocked. Turning around, he decided to up to the next level and find another way down.

The stairwell let him out in the vicinity of the Maternity Ward. The sound of something crashing caught his attention; so he started off in the direction it came from. As he got closer to the Maternity Ward, he was horrified to find blood and disarray in the halls. What happened here?

Finally arriving at the entrance to the Maternity Ward, he heard footsteps around the corner. Before he could go around the corner to investigate, someone grabbed him from behind and pulled him into a nearby supply closet.

Turning around, ready to confront his assailant, Eric was surprised to find a heavily pregnant teenage girl staring back at him. Raising a finger to her lips, whispering, the girl said, “Be quiet if you want to stay alive.”
11111111111111.title: Waking to a World in Disarray

111111111111111.content:
Eric was silent as the footsteps got closer; until he saw a figure appear outside the door. Even though the rain glass window, Eric could tell whatever was outside wasn’t human. The creature, whatever it was, sniffed the air for a few moments before walking off.

Once he was satisfied they were in the clear, Eric turned to the young girl in front of him. “You mind telling me what the hell is going on?”

“Are you serious?” incredulous, the girl said, “Those things have been here for hours.”

The girl, who introduced herself as Madison Decker, proceeded to explain the events of the last few hours to Eric. When she was finished, Eric was in disbelief – he didn’t think anything like that was possible. Then again he had witnessed his sister’s boyfriend get turned into an alien creature.

Once he had a chance to process what he’d been told, Eric looked at Madison and said, “There’s one thing I’m still not clear about; if the hospital was being evacuated, why are you still here?”

“Some cops were escorting a group of us to safety; I fell behind when I started having contractions.” Suddenly wincing in pain, Madison said, “I suppose it was for the best; because those things took all the pregnant women, and some of the men, aboard their ship and took off.”

“Are you alright?” suddenly concerned, Eric said, “You don’t look so good.”

“Gee, thanks.” Wincing, Madison said, “My contractions are getting worse.”

That’s all Eric needed to hear; if what Madison said was true, the aliens seemed unusually interested in pregnant women. He wasn’t going to let them take her. Getting up, he walked over and pulled Madison to her feet. “We have to get you out of here.”

“Are you crazy?” panicking, Madison said, “Those things are everywhere.”

“I’m a cop, Madison; it’s my job to make sure you’re safe.” Opening the door a crack, Eric said, “It looks like the coast is clear, but we just have to make a quick stop first.”

Following Eric out of the supply closet, Madison said, “What for?”

“My sister’s in the ICU; she was attacked by one of those dog-things you saw.” Turning to Madison, trying to sound reassuring,
Eric said, “I promise that I’ll do everything I can to make sure you’re both safe.”

“Okay.” Wincing in pain, Madison said, “We just met; but for some reason, I feel like I should trust you.”

The journey back to the stairwell was as uneventful as Eric hoped; he spotted two of the tall creatures down the hall. Seeing the stairwell door no more than 5 feet away, Eric motioned for Madison to follow. Thankfully they made it to the stairwell, and down one floor, without incident.

With his gun in one hand and Madison’s hand in another, Eric walked down the hall to the ICU. Rounding the corner to Olivia’s room, Eric stopped when he saw the x-ray machine had been moved. Turning to Madison, silently telling her to stay put, he quietly walked down to the room. He could see a shadowy figure through the blinds as he went by. He suddenly heard a moan from inside the room.

Kicking the door open, gun raised, he found himself staring at the girl from the elevator - only this time she was pointing a gun at his face. “You?” looking at her, Eric said, “What the hell are you doing here?”
111111111111111.title: Hiding in a Supply Closet

1111111111111111.content:
“I was trying to find a place to hide.” Her gun raised at Eric’s head, Margo said, “What are you doing here?”

Gesturing to Olivia, who appeared to be semi-conscious on the bed, Eric said, “That’s my little sister; the one I told you about.” Spotting a young boy standing behind her, David said, “Who’s that?”

“This is David, one of my Pediatrics patients.”

Madison wasn’t in the mood for the back and forth she was witnessing; especially as her contractions were getting worse. “Will you guys please stop?” Looking at Eric and Margo, she said, “There may be more of those things in the hospital, and your talking is going to bring them right to us.”

Eric realized Madison was right; the last thing anyone needed was those things finding them. He had a feeling that Margo was trustworthy; so he slowly lowered his weapon, followed shortly after by Margo. Once the weapons had been lowered, Eric went to Olivia’s bed while Margo turned her attention to Madison. “Honey, are you alright?”

“No, not *gasp* really.” Sitting down in a chair, wincing, Madison said, “I *gasp* think I’m going into labor.”
1111111111111111.title: A Standoff

11111111111111111.content:
Margo didn’t miss a beat as she jumped into action, making her way to the bathroom to grab some towels. While Eric stood by Olivia’s bed with David, Margo went back over to where Madison was sitting. “What’s your name, honey?”

Between pained breaths, Madison said, “Ma-Madison.”

“I’m Margo.” Looking at Madison, she said, “How far apart on your contractions?”

“No more than 45 seconds apart.” Screaming in pain, Madison said, “They’re getting pretty bad.”

Keeping his arm around David, Eric said, “Are you sure it’s a good idea to deliver her baby here?” looking at Margo, Eric said, “If there are any of those things left in the building, they’ll hear her screaming.”

“I don’t see that we have a lot of options here.” Looking over her shoulder, as she positioned some towels under Madison, Margo said, “Even if I thought moving Madison was a good idea, your sister is another matter entirely.”

“We have to do something, Margo.” Looking at Margo, Eric said, “I’m not going to let my sister be harmed more than she already has.”

Getting up, Margo turned to look Eric in the eyes; seeing the fearful look in his eyes. The last time she’d seen that look was when her best friend had been captured by the Creel. “Fine, you’ve convinced me.” Sighing, Margo said, “Before we do anything, I need to know exactly what’s wrong with your sister.”

“I’m not entirely sure; the doctor said she’s fighting some nasty infection – something she got when that creature attacked her.”

Margo stood still for a moment as she processed everything going on around her. After a moment, she finally made her decision.
“Okay fine; against my better judgment, we’ll try to get out of here.” Sighing, she said, “But we’re going to have to get a move going.”

Eric was puzzled by Margo's choice of words but knew that this was neither the time nor the place to dwell on it. “Okay then; Margo, you go find a wheelchair for Madison.” Looking at Olivia, he said, “I’ll carry Olivia.”

Margo returned a moment later with a wheelchair; as she helped Madison into it, she said, “Make sure you grab my bag; it has some medicine I think might be able to help Olivia.”

And off they went. As the five of them made their way through the hospital, they failed to encounter any creatures. Margo was relieved to see that the Creel continued to underestimate all non-Creel life forms. Once they were in the parking lot, they found an intact SUV close to the door.

With Eric driving, and David sitting upfront with him, Margo was in back trying to get a handle Madison and Olivia. Madison’s contractions were coming every 20 seconds now; whereas the move had caused Olivia’s heart rate to plummet.

As they drove through the deserted streets of the town, Margo considered her options. She carried doses of antibiotics in case of emergencies, and this was certainly an emergency. However, these antibiotics were developed by Maltorian science, not Terran, and there was no what they would do to Olivia’s system. On the other hand, it appeared that Terran science was ill-equipped to deal with the infection raging through Olivia's body.

“Eric, I need to know how far you’re willing to go in order to save Olivia’s life.”

“What?” glancing back, Eric said, “Do whatever you can to save her, Margo.”

That was all the confirmation Margo needed; as she dug through her bag until she found the series of vials she was looking for. As she filled a syringe with one of the vials, Margo said, “I’m giving her an experimental antibiotic that should help her, but I’m not sure what the side effects might be.”

“Just do it, Margo!”

Margo injected the syringe into Olivia’s left arm; causing her veins to temporarily turn dark blue as the antibiotics moved through her system. Before she could check to make sure Olivia was okay, Margo was Madison as she screamed, “Pull over! I think I feel the baby’s head!”
11111111111111111.title: Attempting an Escape

111111111111111111.content:
4 Hours Earlier

Liz was powerless to do anything as the creatures removed her, and several others, from the ship. It was dark so she couldn’t see what they looked like, but she could tell they weren’t human. The creatures brought Liz, and the 6 other people with her, into a nearby building. As she was led inside, Liz caught a fleeting glimpse of a nearby sign that said - Savanna Academy; a private school on the outskirts of town.

The group was led down the hall to one of the classrooms; walking inside to find that a large cell had been set up inside the room, along with a strange looking machine in front of the board. The tall creatures pushed the group into the cell before walking out of the room. Why are they putting us in cages?

Liz looked around the cell and got an idea of who was in there with her – mostly adults except for one frightened girl clutching her mother. Making her way over to the girl and her mother, she said, “Everything is going to be alright.”

“How do you know?” looking at Liz, the girl said, “I don’t even know where we are!”

“I saw a sign outside that said Savanna Academy; that private school on the outskirts of town.”

“What are those things?” holding her daughter close, the mother said, “What do they want with us?”

“I don’t know, ma’am.” Sighing, Liz said, “But we’re alive, so they obviously need us for something.”

The daughter started crying at that point, as the mother looked down at her and said, “Hailey, sweetie, everything is going to be alright.”

“I’m scared, Mom.”

Looking at Hailey, Liz said, “Your mom’s right, Hailey; everything is going to be alright.”

Suddenly one of the large creatures entered the room and made its way to the cage. Coming inside, it came directly over to Hailey and forcibly removed her from her Mom’s arms. “Mommy!”

“No!” going after the creature, the mom tried to rescue her daughter. “Let her go!”

Without stopping, the creature pushed the mom aside as it removed Hailey from the cell. While two others tended to the mother,
Liz watched as the creature removed Hailey’s clothing before placing her inside the tube. As Hailey tried, in vain, to get out of the tube; Liz looked at her and said, “Hailey, honey, everything is going to be alright.”

The creature pressed a button on the side of the tube; which caused a strange gas to fill the tube. Behind her, Liz could hear the
mom yelling, “Hailey!”

After a moment, the gas dissipated enough to allow everyone to see inside. The room was soon filled with an assortment of gasps and horrified screams – whatever the gas was; it had turned Hailey from a cute young girl into something that resembled a bipedal reptile.
111111111111111111.title: An Alien Prisoner

1111111111111111111.content:
Hailey couldn’t see anything inside the tube as the gas swirled around her; she tried in vain to escape. As the gas started to dissipate, she could hear the muffled reactions of everyone in the cell. What’s going on? Hailey’s confusion soon turned to horror when she caught a glimpse of her reflection in the glass tube. Gone were her freckles, red hair and blue eyes; replaced with a face covered in green scales, orange eyes and a series of bumps going from her nose up through her forehead.

Hailey brought a hand up to her mouth as she screamed in horror; only to find that her hand suddenly had 4 sharp looking claws instead of fingers. Not only that, but she quickly realized her entire body was now covered in green scales. She noticed her feet had changed as well; now having 3 toes that ended with claws. What did they do to me!?

The tube suddenly opened and, before the creature outside could stop her, Hailey ran to the cage door. Whatever had been done to her must’ve increased her strength, because she was able to rip the locking mechanism off the gate without a problem.
Everyone avoided her, except for her mom and the woman who’d tried to comfort her. Going up to her mom, she wrapped her arms tightly around her, “Mommy, what’s going on?”

“I-I don’t know, sweetie; but don’t worry.” Trying to sound reassuring, Hailey’s mom said, “Everything is going to be alright.”
“How can you say that!” looking down at her body, Hailey said, “I-I’m a monster!”

“You’re not a monster, Hailey.” Looking at her, Mom said, “You’re still my precious little girl.”

Suddenly the creature came inside the cage and grabbed Hailey; pulling her away from her Mom. “No! Let me go!” trying to free herself, she said, “Mommy. Help!”

But Mom was unable to do anything, as she was paralyzed with shock. The creature led Hailey down the hall; where she found herself with 5 other kids who looked similar to her. Every one of them, Hailey included, was crying in fear – uncertain of what was going to happen to them next. They didn’t have to wait long as three of the creatures appeared and corralled them outside to where a ship was waiting for them. The six kids were all ushered onto the ship; each of them looking around with a mixture of fear and confusion.

As she took a seat along the wall Hailey watched as two of the creatures brought a sealed container, about the size of a chest freezer, on board. It was only then that Hailey realized her sense of smell was suddenly stronger than before. She wasn’t sure what the smell was that was coming from the container, but something told her it was a good smell.
1111111111111111111.title: Hailey's Transformation

11111111111111111111.content:
Hailey focused her attention on looking out the window; trying to ignore the crying and whimpering from those around her. It was hard for her to do that, because she felt the same way they did. Hailey watched out the window as her town receded from view, wondering where they were being taken.

It didn’t take long for the ship to make it into orbit; after a few minutes, Hailey could see a much larger ship approaching. It was brown in color and resembled an egg with four spires jutting out from the sides. Is that where they’re taking us?

Hailey soon had her answer as the shuttle approached a large opening on the side of the ship. Looking out the window, Hailey saw a dozen or so alien creatures that looked like her. Suddenly someone grabbed Hailey’s hand, startling her. Looking down she saw a young child, probably no older than 5 years old, looking at her. “Where are we?”

“I-I don’t know.” Trying to make a reassuring smile when you mouth was full of razor sharp teeth was difficult, but Hailey tried her best. “What’s your name?”

“C-Caleb.” Whimpering, he said, “I’m scared.”

“Hi Caleb, my name’s Hailey.” Grasping Caleb’s hand, Hailey said, “I’m scared too.”

The shuttle had landed on the deck at the point; a door in the rear opened. This was followed by a guttural voice coming over a hidden speaker that said, “Please disembark the shuttle.”

Hailey and the others briefly hesitated as they were unsure what was going to happen to them once they left the shuttle. When the message repeated a second time, Hailey and the others promptly exited the ship – only to find themselves in a large, dimly lit room. Still holding Caleb’s hand in hers, Hailey joined the other children as they were ushered into a single file line. Looking down at Caleb, Hailey said, “Everything’s going to be alright, Caleb; I promise.”

Caleb looked up at Hailey, a look of fear in his eyes. Moving to hug her, Caleb said, “I want to go home.”

“I want to go home too, Caleb.”

Hailey’s attention was brought back to the ship as she heard the large container being removed. Her nostrils flared as she once again caught the scent of whatever was in the box. Every one of the other children, Caleb included, had the same reaction; whatever was in the container was really appealing to them.

Suddenly a nearby doorway opened and a large creature, different than the ones she’s seen earlier, entered the room. One of the first differences she saw was that it was wearing clothes; leading her to realize that she and the others had been naked the entire trip from the surface.

As the creature got closer, Hailey got a chance to get a good look at it. Based on similarities to Caleb, Hailey figured the creature in front of them was an adult male. That led her to realize that she was one of 3 females in the group. The creature stopped in front of the kids and looked around, his nostrils flaring. “Greetings, younglings, my name is Axic.” Looking at the group, he said, “I want to assure you that there is no need to be frightened.”

“Please let us go!” a boy, around Hailey’s age, said, “We want to go home!.”

“You are home, youngling.”

“Our home is on Earth!” Feeling defiant, Hailey said, “Please, I just want to go back home to my mom!”

“Those insignificant creatures on the surface are no longer your families.” Calmly, Axic said, “We will find your proper parents, and you will be raised as befits a young Creelaxian.”

Hailey didn’t like where this was going; she didn’t want to be a part of whatever this Axic had in store for her and the others. Before she react, a young girl next to her tried to run back towards the ship. She didn’t get far as two guards caught her and brought her back. “I’m not a Creelaxian!” trying to break free, the girl said, “I’ll never be one of you!”

“In time, youngling, you will be one of us.” Looking at the girl, Axic said, “It’s best not to fight.”

A few seconds later the group was ushered into a nearby, smaller room. Axic handed a package to each of the kids, saying, “Put these on, younglings; your parents are waiting for you in the next room.”

Hailey ripped open her bag with ease; lamenting that her claws were good for something. She found a pair of shorts and a shirt; which she reluctantly put on. Once everyone was clothed, Axic led the group through a doorway into a room where a dozen Creelaxian adults were waiting.
11111111111111111111.title: The Fate of the Children

111111111111111111111.content:
The process by which Hailey and the others were presented to their Creelaxian parents took about 20 minutes. Hailey was the last one to be called; as Axic walked up to her. Looking at her, he said, “You are now Drayk, daughter of Evoque and Imkay.”

With the presentations complete, Axic left the room; leaving Hailey alone with her new ‘parents.’ The two of them walked over and the male said, “Hello Drayk, I’m your father Evoque.”

“My name is not Drayk, its Hailey.” Glaring at Evogue, she said, “You are not my parents.”

“You are Creelaxian now; who you were before doesn’t matter.” Looking at her, Imkay said, “I was once a member of another race; one far more advanced than the creatures of this world. But even they were no match for the might of the Creel.”

“We can finish this conversation back in our chambers.” Gesturing towards the door, Evoque said, “It’s almost time for morning meal, and I’m sure Qadeah is anxious to meet her sister.”

Hailey reluctantly followed Evoque and Imkay out of the room; finding herself inside a somewhat cramped passageway. As she walked along, she was bombarded with all sorts of strange smells. She saw quite of a few Creelaxians, of all ages and genders, as she went through.

After climbing up several staircases, and going through a few passages, they finally stopped outside a closed door. Evoque put a code in which caused the door to open; revealing a rather modest looking room, one that reminded Hailey of photos she’d seen of her mom’s first apartment. Mom. I hope she’s alright.

The three of them walked inside as a younger Creelaxian female came out of another room. As soon as she saw Hailey, she came running over. “Is this her? Is this my sister?”

“Of course, Qadeah.” Gesturing to Hailey, Imkay said, “This is your sister, Drayk.”

Qadeah turned her attention to Hailey and reached out to hug her; causing Hailey to take a step back. No matter what anyone said; these were not her parents, and she was definitely not her sister. Qadeah gave Imkay a pained look, which prompted her to say, “It’s alright, Qadeah; give your sister time to adjust.”

Evoque came out of a nearby room carrying a large platter with a cover on top of it. “It is time for the morning meal.”

As frightened as she was, Hailey had to admit that she was starving; and the smells coming from the platter were quite enticing. She hesitantly took a seat next to Qadeah, only then realizing that there were no plates or utensils to be seen. Okay, that’s weird.

Hailey watched as Evoque removed the lid from the platter; her eyes bugging out when she saw the platter contained severed human limbs. If that wasn’t enough for her to lose her appetite, she watched as the other three starting eating; chunks of bloody meat falling from their mouths. I have to get out here!"
111111111111111111111.title: Hailey's New Family

1111111111111111111111.content:
Two things were becoming clear to Margo as she stood on the side of the road: Madison wasn’t exaggerating when she said she could feel the baby’s head, and Eric was totally useless when it came to delivering babies. Yet, despite all that, he wanted to do something to help. “Do I need to go get some water?” standing behind Margo, he said, “I know it won’t be boiling, but...”

Margo had to resist the urge to tell Eric to find some water and drown himself in it. Turning around, she stared at him and said, “Just keep David occupied.” With an exasperated sigh, she said, “This isn’t an ideal location to have a baby; I don’t need him getting in the way.”

Eric nodded and walked a little way down the road with David; leaving Margo alone with Madison in the back seat of the
SUV. Looking at Margo, her face dripping with sweat, Madison said, “Eric’s just *gasp* trying to help.”

“I know, but right now he’s pretty much useless.” Looking at Madison, Margo said, “When you feel your next contraction, I’m going to need you to start pushing.”

Meanwhile, a short way down the road, Eric and David were sitting on the guard rail. Looking at David, who looked worried, Eric said, “Everything’s going to be alright, David; Margo has everything under control.”

“I know.”

Suddenly Eric caught a whiff of smoke coming from nearby. Walking a short distance, getting closer to the smell, he looked down and saw a squad car in a ditch. Turning to David, he said, “David, buddy, I need you to stay right there. I have to go check something; then I’ll be right back.”

David nodded silently as Eric managed to make his way down into the ditch. A closer look at the car showed it was totaled, but Eric figured there were still things he could use. After a few minutes of searching; he came out with a shotgun with about a dozen shells and a bulletproof vest. He was about to leave when he heard something from inside the cab.

Upon closer inspection, he realize the noise was in fact a voice coming over the scanner. Turning up the volume, he heard. “...8 survivors from the church on Maple; we’re bringing them to the prison now.”

That was all he needed to hear; he now had a potentially safe place to bring the group. Climbing back up the hill, with his loot, he went back to where David was sitting. Before he could say anything, he heard a baby’s cry coming from the car.

Taking that as a cue that it was safe to return, Eric and David walked back to the car as Margo walked out from the back.
Seeing them, she said, “It’s a boy.”

With a smile, Eric walked around the back to check on Madison; seeing her holding her newborn son. “What’s his name?”

“Michael.” Looking up at Eric, Madison said, “His name’s Michael.”

“Is that his father’s name?”

“No.” curtly, Madison said, “In fact, I don't think anyone in his father's family is named Michael."

Eric let the matter drop, and turned to find Margo in the middle row checking on Olivia. “How’s she doing?”

“Her breathing is better.” Feeling Olivia’s forehead, Margo said, “I’m pretty sure her fever’s broken.”

Eric let out a sigh of relief; given everything going on, it was nice to have three positive outcomes in a row. “I found a squad car in a ditch up the road; heard something over the radio.” Looking at Margo, he said, “They’ve set up an emergency shelter in the prison; which isn’t too far from here."

“I suppose a prison is better than being out in the open.” pausing, Margo said, “How soon can you get us there?”

“It’s about 15 minutes from here.”

As Margo walked around to get in the middle row with Olivia, she saw that a lock of Olivia’s hair had come out in her hand. She brushed it off her hand, then got into the car.
1111111111111111111111.title: Back on Earth

11111111111111111111111.content:
As it would turn out, Eric’s estimate of 15 minutes was wrong; it ended up taking close to an hour before the group finally arrived at the prison. That was due, in part, to the destruction they found along the way; down power lines, destroyed cars and even a missing bridge.

Eric sat in the driver’s seat as guards in the towers pointed weapons at them. That sight was starting to unnerve David, as he started whimpering in the passenger seat. Looking at David, Eric said, “Don’t worry, buddy; they’re just making sure we’re not a threat.”

It wasn’t long before 3 prison guards walked out through a nearby door; two of them had their hands on their weapons while the third approached the car. As Eric rolled down the window, the guard said, “Please identify yourself.”

“I’m Officer Eric Sheppard, Redford PD.” Showing his badge, Eric said, “Please let us in; I have two young girls in need of immediate medical attention.”

The guard looked through the windows of the SUV to verify Eric’s story. Eventually, he grabbed his radio and said, “Open the gate!”

It took a minute for the gates to open sufficiently for the SUV to enter, but Eric was soon able to drive inside the compound. Parking the car in the middle of the compound, Eric and the others stepped out. Walking up to Eric, Margo said, “I need to get Madison and Olivia to the infirmary.”

The guard who’d let them in must’ve overheard Margo; he came walking over and said, “I’ll escort you there.”

While Madison was able to walk, with some help, Olivia was still unconscious. Eric was about to ask the guard to carry her when Margo picked her up from the car with ease. He was about to ask her how she did that, but quickly figured it was adrenaline.
Once the others went off to the infirmary, David included, another prison guard approached Eric.

“You told one of my men you’re Redford PD, is that correct?”

“That’s right.”

“Your Chief is in the Warden’s office; I imagine he’d want to speak with you.”

As Eric followed the guard into a nearby doorway, he said, “Who’s in charge right now?”

“That’s difficult to say; no one’s heard from the Warden since he went home last night.” Walking up a flight of stairs, the guard said, “For now, I believe your Chief is running the show.”

The guard led Eric down the through the Administrative Wing until they came to a door marked ‘Prison Warden.’ The guard knocked on the door; which prompted a familiar voice to say, “Come in!”

Stepping to the side, the guard opened the door to let Eric into the room; where he found his boss, Chief of Police Michael Weston, standing behind the desk. Walking over to the desk, Eric said, “Officer Sheppard, reporting as ordered.”

As he turned around, Eric expected Chief Weston to respond in a professional manner. So you can imagine his surprise when his boss instead came around the table and hugged him. “Good to see you’re still alive, son.” Chuckling, Chief Weston said, “I heard you were at the hospital with your sister; I feared the worst when I heard it had been attacked.”

“Yes, sir; someone dropped the ball during the evacuation, leaving myself, Olivia and three other people behind.” Trying to control his anger, Eric said, “I’d very much like to meet the son of a bitch who authorized that.”

“I’m not condoning what happened, but you know what can happen in an intense situation like that.” Sitting down on the desk,
Chief Weston said, “Now tell me about Olivia; how is my god-daughter doing?”

Chief Weston was a long-time friend of Eric’s father; the two of them serving in the Navy together in the late 80s. He’d looked after both Eric and Olivia after their parents died. Taking a deep breath, Eric said, “It’s hard to tell, sir; the doctors said they’ve never seen an infection like this.” Sitting down in a chair, Eric said, “Margo, one of the people in my group, was a pediatrics nurse at the hospital; she’s been keeping tabs on Olivia’s condition.”

“I understand you’re probably anxious to check on your sister; so I won’t keep you.” Getting up, Chief Weston said, “I hope you’ll keep me informed of her condition.”

“Yes, sir.”

After leaving the office, Eric met up with the guard who then brought him down to the infirmary.
11111111111111111111111.title: Arriving at the Prison

111111111111111111111111.content:
The first thing Eric did when he reached the infirmary was to ask for Olivia. The orderly, a young woman in her early 20s, pointed to a closed-door leading to an examination room. “She’s in there; being checked on by the doctor.”

With a polite nod, Eric walked passed her and entered the room. He found the doctor, a middle-aged man, checking Olivia’s blood pressure. Closing the door, he said, “How’s she doing, doctor?”

“She’s resting comfortably for the moment.” Looking up, the doctor said, “She’s displaying symptoms I’ve never seen before,
but I do believe she’s out of danger.”

Eric’s reaction to that news was to hug the older man. After a moment, he broke the hug and said, “I’m sorry; i-it’s been a long day.”

“No need to apologize, son; I’d be worried if you didn't react that way.” Grabbing what Eric figured was Olivia’s chart, the doctor said, “I believe your other friend is next door.”

Eric walked out of Olivia’s room and went next door. After knocking, he waited for a response. “Come in.”

Walking into the room, Eric was mildly surprised to find Madison sitting in a chair breastfeeding. He would have thought she’d cover-up but to each their own. Closing the door, he said, “How are you two doing?”

“We’re doing just fine.” Looking at Eric, a smile on her face, Madison said, “Thank you for getting us here, Officer.”

“Think nothing of it, Madison.” Smiling, Eric said, “And, please, call me Eric; after what we’ve been through, it’s only right to be on a first-name basis.”

Madison finished breastfeeding and lay Michael inside one of those hospital bassinets. Climbing into bed, Madison said, “How’s Olivia doing?”

“The doctor said she’s doing fine.” Sighing, Eric said, “Thank you for asking.”

After a few moments, figuring Madison needed some rest, Eric turned to leave. Before he got to the door, Madison came over and hugged him. As Eric returned the hug, Madison said, “I’m really glad I found you at the hospital, Eric.”

Leaning down, Eric gave her a quick kiss on the forehead. “Right back at you, Madison; who knows what would’ve happened had you not found me.”

Breaking the hug, Madison said, “With all the noise you were making, it wouldn’t have taken long for those things to find you.”

****************************


After leaving the infirmary, the next thing Eric did was look for Margo and David. It took him some time but, with the help of a prison guard, he found them sitting at a table inside an empty cell block. Eric had overheard some of the guards saying most of the prisoners had escaped during the initial chaos. I wonder if they’ll have us go after them.

As he got closer, he noticed Margo gently rocking David in her arms as she sang a song to him. Eric didn’t recognize the song but figured that was because he didn’t follow children’s music. Taking a seat next to her, Eric said, “Thank you, Margo; you saved my sister’s life.”

“Don’t thank me, Eric.” Looking at him, Margo said, “I wasn’t sure how she’d react; for all I knew, I was treading on hot water.”

Eric knew he must be tired; there was no way she'd just said that. Looking at Margo, he said, “As long as you’re singing lullabies; do you mind if I catch up on my sleep?”

Before Margo could respond, two guards entered the cellblock and walked right up to Margo. “Ma’am, you need to come with us.” Showing a pair of handcuffs, one of them said, “You’re under arrest.”

Eric wasn’t so tired that he couldn't snap to attention as soon as he heard this. Walking up to the guards, he said, “On what charges?”

“W received a report from a security guard at the hospital.” Putting the cuffs on Margo, the guard said, “She kidnapped a child from the Pediatrics Wing.”
111111111111111111111111.title: Checking On the Group

1111111111111111111111111.content:
With David in his arms, Eric followed behind the guards as they brought Margo to a holding cell. Despite barely knowing her, Eric had a difficult time believing that Margo was capable of what they were saying.

The group entered the holding area, a small hallway with three holding rooms. Putting David in one of the seats, Eric looked at him and said, “I’m going to find out what’s going on, alright?”

Walking up one of the guards, as they walked out of the room, Eric said, “What’s going to happen to her now?”

“If she did kidnap the boy, she’ll likely face some jail time.”

“Let me go talk to her.” sighing, Eric looked at the guard and said, “Maybe this is all just a big misunderstanding.”

“The Chief doesn’t want anyone...Hey!!”

Eric took that opportunity to run into the holding room and close the door. While the guards were pounding on the door, in a vain attempt to enter, he turned to face Margo. “I hope you have a real good explanation for why you tried to kidnap David.” Sighing,
Eric said, “Anything you tell us, literally anything, would be helpful to your case.”

“No, it wouldn’t.” sitting back in the chair, looking at Eric, Margo said, “If anything, it would make my situation worse.”

“Trust me, Margo; I know cops.” Sitting across from her, Eric said, “Do you really think, with everything going on, that they want to spend time on this? Just tell them you were trying to protect David, and they’ll let you go.”

“If I were to tell them that, they’d want to know how I knew he was in danger.” Sighing, Margo said, “If told them that...”

Eric wanted to help Margo, but she wasn’t making it easy for him. He wanted to give her the benefit of the doubt after everything they’ve been through; but he was beginning to realize he really didn’t know anything about her. “I don’t think it’ll go as badly as you think it will.” Looking at her, Eric said, “Try it out on me; how did you know that David would be in danger.”

“Alright, if you really want to know.” Sighing, Margo leaned over the table and said, “I knew David was in danger because I’ve seen firsthand what the Creel are capable of.”

Eric was starting to get confused; wondering who the Creel were, and starting to have doubts about the woman sitting in front of him. Looking at Margo said, “How could you possibly know?”

“I’m not what I appear to be, Eric; I’m a nurse, but I’m also much more than that.” Taking a deep breath, Margo said, “I’m a Maltorian; and 15 years ago, long before they knew about your world, the Creel nearly drove my species to extinction.”

To say that Eric was stunned would be an understatement; he simply couldn’t believe what he’d just heard was true. Looking at Margo, he said, “Okay...”

Leaning back in the chair, Margo looked at Eric and said, “See what I mean?”

*********************************


Eric spent the next two hours sitting outside the holding room while Chief Weston, and the prison interrogator, questioned Margo.
