They’d had a hard time believing Eric when he told them she was an alien; but they quickly changed their tune when they saw her standing in front of the window with her cuffs in pieces on the table.

He was starting to get worried, until the door opened and he saw Chief Weston standing in the doorway. Walking over to the door, Eric saw a few things on the table he couldn’t identify. He watched as the interrogator, whose name he didn’t get, went over to un-cuff Margo. “You’ll understand if we ask that you keep your true identity secret from the general population.”

“I completely understand; there’s no need to cause any more panic.” Turning to Chief Weston, Margo said, “Forgive me for not fully understanding the judicial system of this planet, but can I assume that I’m free to go?”

“Yes ma’am, you’re free to go.” Gesturing out the door, Chief Weston said, “Promise me you won’t try to kidnap any more children.”

Ignoring Chief Weston’s comment, Margo gathered her things and put them in her bag. Walking out of the room, she turned to Eric and said, “Where’s David?”

“He wanted to go see Madison; so I had an officer bring him to the infirmary about half an hour ago.” Looking at Margo, Eric said,
“Don’t worry, he doesn’t know about your secret.”

“It’s only a matter of time before he finds out.” Gesturing to an object with a flashing light, Margo said, “Chief Weston had me activate my distress begin; the Maltorian colony ship will be here tomorrow morning.”

As the two of them walked down the hall, Eric said, “Can your people help us against these...Creel?”

“I don’t know, Eric.” Sighing, Margo said, “My species is technologically on par with the Creel; but they still managed to eradicate 95% of my people, and that says nothing for those they altered to suit their needs.”

“Altered?” confused, Eric said, “What’s that mean?”

“The Creel capture prisoners and alter them on the genetic level to suit their needs.” Stopping in the middle of the hall, Margo said, “I suspect that Olivia’s boyfriend was one of their early victims.”
1111111111111111111111111.title: Getting Answers

11111111111111111111111111.content:
Madison finished having lunch just past noon; when she decided to go check on Olivia. Carefully gathering Michael in her arms, she walked next door to Olivia’s room. Walking into the room, Madison stopped in her tracks when she realized what she was looking at. Olivia’s hair was lying on her pillow in clumps like a halo; and, while she was breathing fine, Olivia’s skin was taking on a blue tint.

Madison was about to get a doctor to look at her when Olivia opened her eyes. “Hello?” seeing Michael asleep in Madison’s arms, she said, “How long was I asleep?”

“Huh?” momentarily confused, Madison said, “Oh, this little guy is mine; I’m Madison Decker.”

“Olivia Sheppard.” Looking around, Olivia said, “This doesn’t look like the hospital.”

“We had to move a few hours ago; we’re at the prison now.”

“Uh huh.” With a perplexed look on her face, Olivia said, “What’s the story with the little guy?”

“I was dating this guy at school; we were getting pretty serious until I found out I was pregnant.” Sighing, Madison said, “The jackass dumped me the second I told him. What about you? What’s your story?”

"I was dating this older guy, and I was just starting to realize that he wasn’t good for me.” Lying back in bed, Olivia said, “Last night he went straight to kidnapping me with the intent to rape. Then he turned into a literal monster and bit me, so I shot him in the face."

Madison had to admit that Olivia’s story was worse than hers. Looking at her, chuckling, Madison said, “Okay, I guess you win."

"The last thing I remember was the doctors saying I had a really nasty infection. I guess it’s clearing up?”

“I don’t know.” Pausing, Madison said, ”Did your infection do that to you?"

“Do what to me?”

Shifting Michael so she could hold him with one hand, Madison took her compact out of her bag. When Olivia went to grab it, both girls saw that the little finger on her hand was curled up; and it resisted Olivia’s efforts to straighten it out.

Looking in the mirror, Olivia saw her hair and her skin. Her screams woke up Michael. She didn't care.
11111111111111111111111111.title: Madison and Olivia

111111111111111111111111111.content:
Eric and Margo were in the cafeteria, eating lunch with David when a guard came running over to them. Out of breath, the guard looked at Eric and said, “Are you Eric Sheppard?”

“Yes.” Concerned, Eric said, “Whose asking?”

“You’re needed in the infirmary.” Pausing, the guard said, “There’s been a development with your sister.”

Margo and Eric took off running before the guard had finished his sentence. The two of them ran into the infirmary to find Madison standing outside Olivia’s room, trying in vain to calm Michael down. Seeing Eric and Margo, she said, “So-Something’s wrong with Olivia.”

Eric followed Margo inside the room to find a couple of orderlies struggling to sedate Olivia. They finally succeeded after a few attempts, leaving her to lie groggily on the bed. It was only then that Eric could see what was happening to Olivia – and it was something he couldn’t explain. Casting a glance at Margo, seeing the horrified look on her face, he thought – maybe she knows what’s going on.

The doctor walked into the room, not surprised to find Eric already there. As soon as he closed the door, Eric said, “What’s happening to my sister, doctor?”

“I haven’t the foggiest idea, son.” Taking a tablet from the counter, he said, “I took a blood sample to compare it one I took when Olivia arrived; it came back with some unusual results.”

Margo and Eric came around to look at the tablet; seeing two side by side images on the screen. Eric didn’t have any medical experience, so he didn’t know what he was looking at, but he knew enough to realize something was definitely different with the two samples. For starters, the newer sample seemed to contain a number of larger looking cells. Looking at the doctor, Eric said, “Could that be the source of Olivia’s infection?”

“I couldn’t begin to fathom a guess.” Sighing, turning off the tablet, the doctor said, “Even if they were the source, I’ve never heard of an infection that could do this to a person; I mean, almost 40% of her skin is blue.”

The doctor stayed for a few minutes before leaving to handle another situation. Closing the door behind once he’d left, Eric turned to Margo and said, “What’s happening with my sister, Margo?”

“I don’t know Eric, I...”

“Stop lying to me!” slamming his hands on the counter, Eric said, “I saw the way you looked at the images, you know what’s happening to my sister and I want to know.”

“Okay, fine; I have an idea of what’s happening to Olivia.” Sighing, Margo said, “Those cells from her blood sample; they’re Maltorian white blood cells.”

“What are Maltorian blood cells doing inside Olivia’s body?”

“The antibiotics I gave her in the car.” Taking a breath, Margo said, “They weren’t developed here on Earth; they were developed on my homeworld.”

Eric couldn’t believe that Margo had given Olivia medicine developed by her people. Looking at her, he said, “You gave Olivia alien medicine; without knowing what it would do to her?”

“I started to have my suspicions after Madison gave birth.” Gesturing to Olivia, who was asleep in the bed, Margo said, “But seeing those test results confirmed that my suspicions were correct.”

“What suspicions?” getting worried, Eric looked at Margo and said, “Margo, what’s happening to my sister?”

“She’s becoming Maltorian.”
111111111111111111111111111.title: Margo Explains

1111111111111111111111111111.content:
Before he knew what he was doing, Eric grabbed Margo and shoved her into the wall. Anger evident in his voice, Eric said, “You mind saying that again?”

“Olivia is showing signs that she’s turning into a Maltorian.” Surprised by Eric’s sudden outburst, Margo said, “I was concerned there might be side effects from using Maltorian medicine on a Terran, but I never imagined anything like this would happen.”

“Dammit, Margo; I trusted you.” Shoving her into the wall again, Eric said, “After everything we’ve been through; you should have told me what might happen.”

“We barely know each other, Eric; if it hadn’t been for the Creel invading, we never would have met.” Having restrained herself until now, Margo quickly grabbed Eric’s arm and twisted it at an unnatural angle. “Now I really don’t want to break your arm, but I will if you leave me no choice.”

Eric tried to resist but the pain was becoming unbearable; he then remembered what Margo had done to the handcuffs. “Okay, I yield.”

As she released Eric’s arm, Margo said, “I’m willing to keep helping Olivia; but not if you’re going to let your emotions get in the way.”

“Listen here, you...”

“Will you two stop it!”

Eric and Margo turned around, in disbelief, to find Olivia standing in front of them. Whatever changes were happening to Olivia seemed to be progressing; as her skin was now more than 60% blue. Looking at Margo, confused, Eric said, “They pumped her full of sedatives; how can she possibly be awake, let alone on her feet?”

“Her Maltorian physiology must be asserting itself,” Turning to Eric, Margo said, “Maltorians have a heightened resistance to foreign substances. Apparently the sedatives that were used weren’t strong enough for a Maltorian.”

Looking at Eric and Margo, more confused than ever, Olivia said, “Would someone please tell me what’s going on?”

Margo spent the next 30 minutes explaining everything to Olivia; from being born on another planet to her mission on Earth. When it came time to explain what was happening to her, Margo said, “If I’d known this would happen, I would’ve kept using Terran medicine.”

Sitting on the bed, looking at her changed appearance, Olivia looked up at Margo. “So let me get this straight; you’re a Maltorian?”

“That’s right; I was born on a world 20 light-years from here.” Leaning against the wall, Margo said, “I only look human for the purpose of my mission.”

Looking at her left arm, which was now almost completely blue, Olivia said, “The stuff you gave me; it’s turning me into a member of your species?”

“Correct.” Sighing, Margo said, “Unfortunately, with the technology present, there’s no way I can stop the changes.”
As Margo dug through her bag, Olivia said, “How long do I have before I’m...”

Finding what she was looking for, a small rectangular device, Margo said, “I won’t know that answer until I can run a scan.”
Running it over Eric’s body, Margo showed the readout to both Olivia and him. “The scan shows that Eric’s DNA is 100% human.”

“I’m almost afraid to ask what it will say about me.”

As Eric took Olivia’s hand in his, Margo ran the device over her body. Once the scan was finished, Margo looked at the readout and sighed. “It appears Olivia is now 55% Maltorian and 45% Terran.”

That news was enough to cause Olivia to pass out again; leaving Eric and Margo to stare at each other.

******************************


Meanwhile, aboard the Creel vessel, Hailey was struggling to resist the Creel's attempts to indoctrinate her.
1111111111111111111111111111.title: Olivia's Fate

11111111111111111111111111111.content:
As the day progressed, Hailey was struggling to continue her resistance. She’d begun resorting to reminding herself of her name, her mother’s name and the lullaby she’d sing to Hailey whenever she got sick. But not everything she did was working; more than once, when trying to sing the song to herself, Hailey found that she forgetting the words.

Still refusing to call them her parents, Hailey had told Evoque and Imkay that she needed to be alone for a while. Despite not knowing her way around the ship, she eventually found herself in a large room with a window overlooking Earth; the sight of which made her pine for a return to her family.

She sat at a table overlooking the window, trying to ignore the plethora of foreign smells when she noticed four Creel entering the room. Looking at them, she recognized the two young Creel as Caleb and the girl who’d tried to make a run for it. Putting two and two together, she realized the adults were their ‘parents.’

Caleb noticed her and walked over; as the two adults sat nearby with the girl. Sitting down, Caleb looked at her and said, “Hi.”

“Hi.”

Before they could continue talking, they were interrupted when the girl yelled, “My name is Rachel!” making a fist with her clawed hand, the girl said, “Call me that or don’t call me anything at all!”

Hailey realized Rachel, for whatever reason, was having better luck resisting then she was. Turning to Caleb, she said, “I see Rachel’s doing her best to resist; what are you doing to remind yourself that you're human?”

“Why would I need to remind myself that I’m human?” looking at her strangely, Caleb said, “I’m Creel.”

Hailey tried her best to hide her shock; just a few hours earlier, Caleb had been begging to go home. Now it appeared as though he’d given into the Creel. Before she could say anything, they were interrupted by the a Creel woman’s voice. “There you are.”

Hailey looked up to find the two Creel adults standing over them; looking behind them, she saw Rachel sitting at a nearby table. Looking at Caleb, the female said, “Are you and your friend enjoying yourselves, Nirav?”

Caleb, now going by the name Nirav, looked up at the female. “She thinks she’s human, mother.”

Hailey could practically hear the shock in Nirav’s voice; as though it was the most ridiculous thing he’d ever heard. Looking at them, the male said, “She will come around, eventually; as will your sister.”

“We’ve brought you a special treat, my youngling.” Digging into a bag on her side, the female said, “Fresh quinnum.”

Hailey watched as she handed Nirav a rat-like creature; one that was still alive. Hailey watched, horrified, as Nirav promptly bit its head off. She then proceeded to leave the room so she could throw up in private.
11111111111111111111111111111.title: Hailey's Losing Battle

111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After throwing up at the sight of Nirav eating a live creature, Hailey decided the best thing for her to do was go back to the quarters of her ‘family.’ Not knowing the code, she instead knocked on the door and waited for it to open. She didn’t have to wait long; for the door opened to reveal Qadeah standing there.

A smile formed on her face, or rather something resembling a smile. Looking at Hailey, she said, “Drayk! We’re about to play a game of dryads, come join us!”

Hailey didn’t know what kind of game dryads was, and she didn’t really care, but she saw Evoque and Imkay holding what looked like cards in their hands. As the door closed behind her, Hailey said, “I’m feeling a little tired; would it be alright if I lay down before evening meal?”

“Of course, Drayk.” Looking at her, Imkay said, “Would you like me to wake you for evening meal?”

Hailey didn’t even care that Imkay was calling her Drayk. Looking at her, she said, “I guess so.”

Hailey walked into the sleeping area she was to share with Qadeah; as she climbed into bed, she said to herself – Whatever else happens, I’ll still be me in my dreams.

In her dream, Hailey found herself sitting in her kitchen at her last birthday party. All of her friends were there to celebrate her big day; cheering as she blew all the candles out in one breath. The girl next to her, whose name she couldn’t remember, asked, “What did you wish for Hailey?”

Hailey didn’t answer; instead, she opened her mouth and ripped out the girl’s throat with her teeth. Blood dripped from her mouth as the others started screaming in horror. A few of them tried to stop her, but Hailey found her claws were just as deadly as her fangs. Less than two minutes passed before she’d killed them all. Pathetic humans; are they good for anything?

Looking at her reflection in the fridge, she saw her former human reflection with her new Creel reflection – a chunk of meat hanging out of her mouth. Well, she acknowledged, they're good for one thing, as she began to devour them...

Hailey bolted upright in bed; still tasting the flesh of her friends and the sheer joy she’d felt s slaughtering them. "No," she whispered to herself, "please, no....”

Hailey cried herself to sleep. When Imkay woke her an hour later, Drayk walked out of the room and joined her family for dinner.
111111111111111111111111111111.title: Hailey's Last Nightmare

1111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Maltorian Colony Ship
In Orbit of Gas Giant
4.37 Light Years from Earth

It wasn’t every day that Borza Trogrik, an Overseer in the Observer Corps, was called to the command deck. As Overseer, he was responsible for the supervision of observation teams on inhabited worlds.

Walking onto the command deck, he overheard distant conversations about the progress of resupplying the ship. The Colony Ship, home to 2000 Maltorians, had arrived in the system two weeks earlier to resupply. He thought they had another week to go before the resupply was finished, so he was confused as to why he heard the last of the ships was returning.

Borza walked up to a viewport overlooking the bow of the ship; stopping behind an older man. “Councilor, Overseer Trogrik reporting as requested.”

Councilor J'Sepp Uavoo was the head of the Maltorian Ruling Council; effectively making him the commander of the ship. Turning around to face Borza, he said, “Overseer Trogrik; when was the last time you received an update for Observation Team 7 – the ones sent to observe the Terrans.”

“About two weeks ago, sir.” Growing concerned, Borza said, “Why do you ask?”

“We have received a distress call from a member of the team, your niece Sorain Kekeva.”

Borza’s heart skipped a beat at the thought his niece was in danger. Looking at Councilor Uavoo, he said, “What’s the nature of the distress call, sir?”

“It seems the Creel have invaded that world.” Seeing the horrified look on Borza’s face, Councilor Uavoo said, “We’ve begun departure preparations; we should arrive in orbit in 13 hours.”

Borza excused himself and left the command check; not wanting the Councilor to see him panicking. As he got into a nearby lift, he said to himself, “Hang on, Sorain; we’re coming for you.”
1111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Distress Call

11111111111111111111111111111111.content:
A few hours had passed since Margo had informed Eric of what was happening to his sister. Against her better judgment, Eric had convinced her to bring the prison doctor in on what was happening. He took the news surprisingly well; although the preponderance of evidence certainly helped.

By this point Olivia’s appearance becoming less human by the minute; her little fingers and little toes were all gone, her skin was completely blue and Eric could swear that her skull was getting longer.

Olivia was understandably having trouble dealing with everything; as she’d spent the last 15 minutes looking at her reflection in a mirror. Bringing a hand up to her face, Olivia said, “Had I not seen Kyle turn into that creature, I wouldn’t have believed anything like this was possible.”

“I’m still having trouble; it’s not every day your little sister turns into a blue alien.”

“You’re not still angry with Margo, are you?” putting the mirror down, Olivia looked at Eric and said, “It’s not like she knew anything like this was going to happen.”

“She treated you with alien medicine, O.” sighing, Eric said, “Even if she didn’t know this would happen, she had to know the risks.”

“Okay, I understand you feel the need to be angry with her.” Taking a breath, Olivia said, “But right now I need her support; she’s the only one here who knows what it’s like to be Maltorian.”

Eric started to realize Olivia was right; Margo was the only one in the prison who had an understanding of what she was dealing with. Before he could say anything, the door opened as Margo and the Doctor walked inside. As they closed the door, Eric saw they had discouraged looks on their faces. “I’m guessing you don’t have good news.”

“Yes and no.” looking at us, the Doctor said, “The good news is Olivia’s condition is stable; the bad news is, we have no way of
reversing the changes.”

Looking at them, Olivia said, “What’s that mean, exactly?”

“Based on my scans, I suspect you’ll be 100% Maltorian by tomorrow morning.” Sighing, Margo said, “There’s no sign of any remaining Terran DNA in your system.”

Eric went to hold Olivia’s hand as she processed the information she’d just been given. Turning to look at Eric, she was about to say something when the door opened again. Before anyone could stop her, Madison walked in carrying a tray of food. “Hey, I thought perhaps Oli...”

Those inside the room could only watch as Madison dropped the tray of food when she saw Olivia’s new look.
11111111111111111111111111111111.title: Back at the Prison

111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Olivia was the first to act, getting up and running to Madison's side. "Are you okay?"

Madison looked at her in disbelief. "Am I okay? You look like a Smurf had a wild night with a Conehead, and you ask if I'm okay?"

Olivia shrugged. "Like it or not, this is who I am now. This is what I am."

"And what are you?"

"Apparently, I'm a Maltorian, or I soon will be. I'm definitely not human anymore. Not a trace of terrestrial DNA anywhere in my system."

"How?"

"I was dying from an infection carried by the bite of that thing my ex turned into. Margo is Maltorian, and knew of something that had the potential to help. The catch was, she had no idea what effect the Maltorian medicine might have on a Terran patient."

"How can you be so calm about this?"

"I miss the old me more than you do. I grew up having my father's eyes and my mother's hair. But that strikes me as a silly reason to wish myself dead. And that's what we're talking about, believe you me." She put her arm around Madison. "I'd rather be an alien who got to see your son, than a human who slowed you down by making you bury me."

"She's right," Margo said. "You would have been slowed down by disposing of her body, and you wouldn't want the Creel to get their claws on her."

"She'd be dead," Eric said. "What would they have done that could be so horrible?"

Margo answered his question clearly and concisely: "They're carnivores."
111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

choices: An Incident at the Prison (During the Night)
1111111111111111111111111111111113.content:
Liz had lost track of how long she’d been in her prison cell; the creatures had confiscated all electronics and covered the windows. The only thing she was certain of was that she was in grave danger. Ever since the creatures had transformed the little girl and took her away, they’d returned at regular intervals to remove someone else.

The same chain of events happened each time; the creatures would come in, the people would scream and they were never seen or heard from again. That had continued until there were only four people, including her, left in the cell – having started with 18 people.

One of the few remaining people happened to be the mother of the girl who’d been taken. She had been in a catatonic state since that happened; lying on the floor in the fetal position. Liz couldn’t really blame her; she’d probably react the same way in her situation.

Liz and the others alternated looking after her; it was currently Liz’s turn. She had no idea what to say to the woman, whose name she never learned, so she resorted to gently caressing her body. Suddenly she was startled by a nearby sound. She looked over to find another cellmate, a man in his 40s, holding a pipe in his hands. Looking at him, he said, “What are you planning to do with that?”

“I’m going to escape; I have no intention of being taken away by those...things.”

“I don’t think that’s a good idea, sir.” Sighing, Liz said, “We shouldn’t do anything to anger these things.”

“How can you say that?” pointing to the catatonic mother, the man said, “Especially after we all saw what they did to her little girl.”

“There are only 3 of us in any condition to do anything; god knows how many of those things are out there.”

“I don’t care, I’m going to make a break for it the next time they come in here.”

***********************


The gentlemen didn’t have very long to wait; as a creature entered the room a short time later. Entering the cell, it went to grab a young man in his late teens. Liz found herself paralyzed by fear as the creature pulled the young man towards the door.

Out of the corner of her eyes, she saw the older man prepare to make his move. She watched as he slowly snuck up behind the creature. He was about to strike it in the head with the pipe when, to her surprise, Liz yelled out, “Don’t!”

Still holding the young man, the creature spun around and grabbed the older man by the throat. He dropped the pipe as the creature carried both of them towards the cage; the older man staring at Liz in anger, “I hope you rot in hell!”

Liz could only watch as the creature closed the gate and dragged the two men out of the room; hearing their screams recede into the distance. Moving backward, towards the wall, Liz started crying; fearing she’d never leave this place alive.
1111111111111111111111111111111113.title: Dwindling Numbers, Dwindling Hope

11111111111111111111111111111111131.content:
Due to the urgency of the situation, the 4 light-year journey to Earth only took 8 hours. The Maltorian colony ship had just arrived in orbit around the Moon when Borza arrived back on the command deck.

He walked through the room until he came up behind Councilor Uavoo; who was getting a status report from another officer.
“Councilor, we’ve arrived in orbit on the far side of Earth’s moon.” Pausing, the female officer said, “We’ve detected the Creel ship in orbit of Earth’s northern hemisphere.”

“Have they detected us?”

“No sir; the Moon’s gravity well has shielded us from their sensors.”

As the officer walked off, Borza looked at Councilor Uavoo. “Councilor, sir, have you made contact with the observation team?”

“Not yet, Overseer, but we’re endeavoring to do so as we speak.” Looking at Borza, Councilor Uavoo said, “I understand your need to find your niece.”

“She’s the only family I have left, sir.”

Just then the female officer came back over; this time with a solemn look on her face. “Councilor. Overseer. We’ve detected debris in orbit; analysis shows they’re the remains of the team’s evac pods.”

No. Looking at the officer, Borza said, “Are you still picking up my niece’s distress signal?”

“Yes sir; it’s coming from a location in the Northwestern Hemisphere.” Sighing, the officer turned to Uavoo and said, “With your permission, councilor, we’d like to send a shuttle to investigate.”

“Permission granted.” Turning to Borza, Uavoo said, “I want you on that shuttle, Overseer.”

“Thank you, sir.”
11111111111111111111111111111111131.title: Arriving in Orbit (The Maltorians)

111111111111111111111111111111111311.content:
Meanwhile, back on Earth...

It was shortly after 5:00 in the morning and, having gotten used to being at work for 6, Eric was already awake. After getting dressed, he decided to go check on Olivia.

Eric walked into the infirmary, a few minutes later, to find the door to Madison’s room open. He took a quick peek inside and found both her and David asleep in the bed. Seeing that, it only served to change his opinion of Madison. Far from being a stubborn, self-centered teenager; Eric was starting to realize that Madison was incredibly mature for her age. Eric wasn’t condoning teen pregnancy, but he felt Madison was going to be a great mother to Michael.

Closing the door, Eric went next door to Olivia’s room; walking inside to find Olivia and Margo both fast asleep. Olivia’s changes had started to slow down; Eric noticed that her skull had finished changing, now close to resembling the crystal skulls he’d learn about in high school.

Walking over to Margo, he gently nudged her until she woke up. Looking up at Eric, she said, “What time is it?”

“It’s about 5:15 in the morning.” Sighing, Eric said, “You feel like getting a bite to eat?”

“Sure.” Getting up, Margo said, “I was up most of the night talking with Olivia; she had a lot of questions about Maltorians.”

“Well she’s Maltorian now, it makes sense that she’d want to know about them.”

“I suppose that’s fair.”

Eric and Margo talked during their walk to the cafeteria; during which time they noticed Margo was getting a fair amount of dirty looks. Looking at Margo, Eric said, “Why are people staring at you like that?”

“I was wondering that myself.” Stopping, Margo turned to Eric and said, “You don’t think my secret got out, do you?”

That was something Eric was wondering as well, but couldn’t bring himself to think it was the case. “I doubt it; both Chief Weston and the interrogator promised to keep that a secret.”

“I hope you’re right.” Pausing, Margo said, “Because I’ve seen enough Terran movies to know your species generally doesn’t respond well to aliens.”

“I think you’re getting ahead of yourself, Margo.” Trying to sound reassuring, Eric said, “As far as everyone’s concerned, you’re a human woman.”

The two had arrived at the cafeteria by that point; walking inside to find some inmates, under guard, eating in the corner. Eric also saw a few civilian survivors eating nearby. A few prisoners stopped what they were doing when they saw Margo standing in the doorway.

They were too far away to hear what they were saying, but Eric and Margo could see that they talking to each other. Eric was starting to get an uneasy feeling as they walked past the group on the way to the kitchen. Before either of them could respond, a large tattooed man stepped in front of them. “We heard about what you did to that girl, freak.” Shoving Margo into a nearby pole, the prisoner said, “We won’t let you do the same to us.”

As much as Eric wanted to see Margo beat the crap out of the man, Eric knew that would cause a problem. Going over, he tried to separate them. “Let go of her, right now.”

A few more inmates got up when they saw Eric grabbing their friend. Thinking he was protected, the man said, “Why are you even protecting her?” scoffing, glaring at Margo, he said, “She’s not even really human.”

Margo was shocked to hear that last bit. Looking at the prisoner, she said, “Who told you that?”

“It’s all over the joint, freak; how you turned one of us into one of you.” Smirking, the man said, “Is that how you get your kicks on your world?”

“Let’s get one thing straight, pal.” Grabbing the man by the collar, Eric said, “My sister is not, never was, and never will be one of you.”

Realizing his grip on Margo, the man turned to Eric and said, “You better let go of me, cop, if you know what’s good for you.”
Before Eric could react, Margo grabbed the man and shoved him into the pillar; causing the pillar to crack in a few places. “Lay a hand on him again, and you’ll regret it.”

Having focused all her attention on the main prisoner, Margo hadn’t noticed another prisoner come up behind her. Eric noticed he was carrying a shiv; but before he could react, he jabbed it into Margo’s side.
111111111111111111111111111111111311.title: Prisoner Problems

1111111111111111111111111111111113111.content:
Eric was certain that would be the end of the Margo; a certainty that her assailant shared as well. So everyone was surprised when Margo simply turned to him and said, “You argue that I’m different than you; but, when you wished to harm me, you assumed my vital organs were in the same place as yours.

The man with the shiv had friends, and they soon piled on top of Margo. While he could only see a swarm of bodies, there was something about the fight that gave Eric reason to pause. He stood by as a group of prison guards, some in riot gear, came running in to restore order.

Even some of the civilian refugees came running to join the assault. It was at that moment Eric realized what seemed odd about the fight. Even with the sheer number of combatants against her, Margo was being awfully silent. Before the guards could enter the fracas, he looked at them and said, “Wait.”

Soon enough it became clear that the mob was thinning; until only Margo was left standing in the middle of the cafeteria. Eric was surprised that she was barely breaking a sweat, and the stab wound seemed to be her only serious injury – and that was beginning to clot over.

“Margo, are you alright?”

Ignoring Eric, Margo dug through the pile of stunned assailants until she found the man who’d accosted her. “My people have a word for those who fight like you and your friends." She pulled him closer to her face. "I believe the closest word in your language is 'noobs.' By all rights, I should - "

Suddenly the room was awash with light; followed by the sound of something landing out in the yard.
1111111111111111111111111111111113111.title: Bad Idea

11111111111111111111111111111111131111.content:
While the guards took the assailants into custody, Eric and Margo made their way out to the yard. As they walked through the hall, Eric looked at Margo and said, “Are you alright? That wound looked pretty bad.”

“I’ll be fine; just going to be sore for a while.” Wincing, Margo said, “I’m just thankful Maltorians only have one kidney; otherwise I would be in trouble.”

“I’m sorry that happened; I’m certain Chief Weston will make sure it doesn’t happen again.”

“Forgive me if I don’t share your optimism, Eric.” Walking up some stairs, Margo said, “I’ve read enough of your history to know your species has a knack for discriminating against those they feel are different.”

The two of them arrived in the yard just as Chief Weston and some prison guards arrived to cordon off the area. Apparently word of Margo’s secret had spread further than anticipated, as some civilians began pointing and yelling at her. As they walked up to Chief Weston, he took one look at Margo and said, “I heard what happened; I assure you it won’t happen again.”

“Thank you, Chief.”

By that point the guards had cordoned off a large area around the ship; Eric stood by while Margo walked up to the back of the ship. It wasn’t long before the back door opened and two Maltorians walked out. Eric suspected Margo must’ve known one of them because she walked over and hugged him.

After conversing for a few seconds, Margo walked over with the two Maltorians. “Eric Sheppard. Chief Weston. Allow me to introduce Borza Trogrik and Phiemu Crican.”

Chief Weston and Eric shook the hands of both men. Once that was finished, Borza turned to Eric and said, “My niece has informed me of the situation regarding your sister. With your permission, I would like to see her now.”

The group was soon escorted into the prison; as Eric stayed back to speak with Margo. “Borza’s your uncle?”

“That’s right; he’s my mother’s older brother.” With a sad look on her face, Margo said, “He took me in after the Creel attacked my world.”

Eric made a note to ask Margo, at some point, to tell him what happened to her world. Walking down the hall, Eric said, “What exactly can do for Olivia that you haven’t already?”

“If you’re hoping they can reverse the changes done to her, that’s not very likely.” Sighing, Margo said, “The most they can do is offer to bring her up to the Colony Ship; to ensure that she’s healthy and not experiencing any side effects.”

The group arrived at the infirmary a few minutes later; walking inside to find Madison pacing around the room trying to get Michael to stop crying. Eric had to give her credit for not freaking out at the sight of Borza and Phiemu. As Eric walked by, he looked at her and said, “What’s up with the little guy?”

“The noise outside woke him up.” Trying to rock Michael, Madison leaned over and said, “Are they here to help Olivia?”

“Yes.”

After asking Madison to go back into her room, Eric walked over to where Borza and the others were speaking with the Doctor. Eric had completely forgotten that Chief Weston didn’t know what had happened with Olivia. That became apparent when he said, “I was told it was a simple bacterial infection; what kind of side effects are we talking about here.”

“With Eric’s permission, I think it would be easier to show you.”

With a nod from Eric, the Doctor opened the door to let everyone inside the room. Olivia was lying awake in bed. Chief Weston took one look at Olivia and turned to Eric. “Is this some kind of joke?” incredulous, he said, “Where’s Olivia?”

“I’m right here, Uncle Michael.” Getting out of bed, Olivia said, “I know I don’t look the same as I used to, but it’s really me.”
So began a long conversation where everything was explained to Chief Weston. When the explanation ended, annoyed, he turned to Eric and said, “Why would you keep something like this from me, Eric?”

“Forgive us, sir; but we didn’t know what was happening until after we got here.” Pausing, Eric said, “We would have told you sooner, but you were too busy running the prison.”

“You should’ve have found the time to tell me, Eric.” Gesturing to Olivia, Chief Weston said, “She’s my god-daughter for god’s sake!”

“She’s my sister, sir; and I’ll do anything to keep her safe.”

Turning his attention to Borza, who had been conferring with Margo in the corner, Chief Weston said, “I assume there’s nothing you can do to reverse these changes?”

“I’m afraid not; especially after what my niece has told me.” Turning his attention to Olivia, Borza said, “With your permission,
Olivia, we would like to bring you up to our ship.”

Getting nervous, Olivia said, “What for?”

“They just want to make sure you’re healthy, O.”

Things moved quickly after that; as Chief Weston left to clear a path from the infirmary to the ship. The Doctor came back into the room with a hazmat suit. Handing it to Olivia, he said, “Put this on, young lady; that way no one can see what you look like.”

Everyone left the room as Olivia got changed. While they waited, Borza came over to Eric and Margo, “I’ll be flying back to the ship with you; Phiemu will stay here to brief your leader about the Creel.”

Madison came back out of her room at that point. Seeing the activity in the infirmary, she looked at Eric and said, “What’s going on, Eric?”

“The Maltorians are going to take Olivia up to their ship; to make sure she’s healthy.”

At that point, Olivia walked out of her room in full hazmat gear. Madison walked past Eric and went over to hug Olivia. “Stay safe, Olivia.”

“You too, Madison.” Hugging her back, Olivia said, “I’m sure I’ll be back before you know it.”
11111111111111111111111111111111131111.title: The Maltorians Arrive

111111111111111111111111111111111311111.content:
Chief Weston must’ve arranged for some security as the group made their way back to the yard. A few of them glanced at Olivia but didn’t say anything. Eric was walking next to her, holding her hand is his. “Everything is going to be alright, O.”

“I hope you’re right.” Looking at Eric, Olivia said, “Why does Margo’s shirt have a bloodstain on it?”

Not wanting to go into too much detail, Eric simply said, “Some frightened individuals found out about Margo’s secret, and they tried to harm her because of it.”

Looking at Eric, worry in her eyes, Olivia said, “I’m not human anymore, Eric; what’s to stop them from doing the same to me.”
“I’m not going to let that happen, O; you have my word.”

The group arrived at the yard a few minutes later; the armed escort keeping everyone from getting too close to Olivia and Margo. That didn’t stop a few of them from yelling obscenities at them. Eric realized this was the last thing that Olivia needed right now.
As the group walked through the makeshift barrier put in place by Chief Weston, Borza said to Eric, “I’ve informed my pilot that we’re to take off as soon as everyone is aboard.”

“Thank you for doing this, sir.” Sighing, Eric said, “Olivia’s the only family I have left in the world.”

“I understand, Eric Sheppard.” Gesturing to Margo, who was walking ahead of them, Borza said, “Sorain...I mean Margo, is the only other member of my family to survive the Creel invasion of my world. I would do anything to keep her safe.”

The group stopped at the back hatch of the shuttle; waiting as it lowered to the ground. Once it was lowered, the group quickly boarded the shuttle before it started to close again. While Borza went to ensure the hatch was secure, Olivia and Eric went to take a seat along the far wall. Margo was about to join them when a Maltorian female came out of the cockpit. Focusing on Borza, she said, “The engines are warmed up, and Command knows...”

The female stopped speaking the moment she saw Margo standing in front of her. Likewise, Margo stopped what she’d been doing as well. From the looks they were giving each other, Eric figured the two must’ve known each other. He didn’t know how well until Margo walked over and gave the woman a passionate kiss on the lips.
111111111111111111111111111111111311111.title: Going to the Ship

1111111111111111111111111111111113111111.content:
Eric and Olivia exchanged surprised looks with each other as they watched Margo kissing the woman in front of them. They broke the kiss after a few moments; with Margo looking at the woman. “I have to admit, Dhelo, you’re the last person I expected to see.”

“The feelings mutual, Sorain.” Looking at Margo, Dhelo said, “Although I’m not exactly surprised; you’re too stubborn for the Creel to kill.”

Getting up from his seat, Eric walked over to Margo and Dhelo. “Margo, do you know her?”

“Margo?” looking perplexed, Dhelo said, “Is that your human name?”

Ignoring Dhelo for a moment, Margo turned to Eric and said, “Eric Sheppard; I’d like you to meet Dhelo Ros’ath – in terms, you’ll understand, she’s my ex-girlfriend.”

Eric briefly shook Dhelo’s hand before looking back at Margo. “Let me get this straight; everything you told me about that blind date was real? That wasn’t just some bullshit you came up with?”

Before Margo could respond, Dhelo turned to her and said, “Have you gone native, Sorain?”

Eric noticed Dhelo using the word Sorain again; he made a note to ask Margo what that was about. Meanwhile, Margo looked at Dhelo and said, “I was sent here to understand these people, Dhelo.”

Scoffing, Dhelo said, “I understand my ship pretty well, and I never thought about sleeping with it.”

As it became clear that Dhelo and Margo had some unfinished business, Eric was relieved when Borza stepped forward. “Dhelo, you can finish your reunion later.” Sighing, he said, “We only have a brief window to sneak past the Creel vessel.”

“Sorry sir.” Exchanging a look with Margo, Dhelo said, “We’ll be airborne momentarily.”

********************************


While Borza joined Dhelo in the cockpit, Margo joined Olivia and Eric in the back. As she strapped herself in, Margo turned to Olivia and Eric. “You both may want to strap in; Dhelo’s takeoffs were always a little rough.”

Eric and Olivia followed Margo’s advice; strapping themselves in just as Dhelo took off. Margo wasn’t kidding; the whole ship shook a little as we gained altitude. Turning to Margo, Eric said, “Dhelo kept calling you Sorain. Is that your real name?”

“That’s right.” Nodding, Margo said, “My real name is Sorain Kekeva; but if you can continue calling me Margo if you’d like.”

After a few bumpy moments, Olivia looked at Margo and said, “So Dhelo seems nice.” Chuckling, she said, “I’m not really into girls; but for a blue alien, she’s pretty attractive.”

“Thank you.” Smiling, Margo said, “We met when I was 16; we were in the same training group. One thing led to another; and we started dating.”

“You said she was your ex-girlfriend.” Curious, Eric said, “What happened to break you guys up?”

“The same thing that tends to end Terran relationships; our careers got in the way.” Sighing, Margo said, “She was training to be a combat pilot, and I’d just ended my apprenticeship with the Observer Corp. We started fighting a lot; until she decided to end things with me.”

Eric could tell that Margo was still hurt by what happened. Looking at her, he said, “Perhaps you weren’t meant to be together.” Pausing, Eric said, “Maybe there’s someone else out there for you.”

“It’s funny you mention that.” Chuckling, Margo said, “The woman I went on the date with, Liz; I connected with her in a way I’d never had with Dhelo. If it hadn’t been for the Creel invasion, I definitely would have asked for a second date. Now – I don’t even know if she’s alive.”

Olivia, in an attempt to change the subject, said, “Can you tell me what I can expect once we reach your ship?”

“You’ll be brought for a medical exam, to ensure there are no complications.” Looking at Olivia, Margo said, “Until now, I never thought such a thing was possible; so they'll want to make sure you're healthy.”

“Will I be able to return to the prison once they’re done with me?”

“I don’t know, Olivia; I’m sure the Governing Council will want to weigh in on the situation.”

Eric could see that Olivia was starting to get worried. Taking her hand in his, he said, “Don’t worry, O; we’ll get through this together.”

Olivia leaned over and rested her head on Eric’s shoulder. With a sigh, she said, “Thanks, Eric.”

Suddenly the cabin was filled with Dhelo’s voice coming over an intercom. “We’re approaching the Mothership.”

Margo was the first to stand up and walk towards the cockpit; although Eric couldn’t really blame her. After all, it had been over a year since she’d seen her home. Olivia and Eric followed behind her; walking into the cockpit just as the ship came into view
ahead of them.

The ship, like nothing Olivia or Eric had ever seen before, was in a low orbit on the far side of the moon. Eric was immediately reminded of the line from Contact - They should have sent a poet. Eric and Olivia were speechless as they watched the ship get larger in the window. The ship had to be at least 25 miles across and shaped almost like a manta-ray. Looking at Margo, in awe, Olivia said, “Does your...I mean our entire species live on that ship?”

“That’s right, Olivia; all 1500 of us.” Moving to the side, to allow for a better view, Margo said, “I must say, it’s good to be home again.”

Eric and Olivia stood in the rear of the cockpit while Dhelo piloted the s the shuttle towards the raised section in the middle of the hull. A hanger door opened as they got closer; within seconds the shuttle had flown inside and the doors closed again.
1111111111111111111111111111111113111111.title: Flying into Space

1111111111111111111111111111111113111111.content:
The interior of the mothership lived up to the promise of the exterior, in the eyes of Eric and Olivia. The corridors were circular, and light blue.

Margo, Eric, and Olivia followed Borza to the medical bay, with Eric acutely aware of the way the Maltorians were looking at him. It was, he realized, the same way the people of Earth looked at Olivia and the Maltorians.

At the medical bay, Maltorians in garb akin to medical scrubs on Earth escorted Olivia inside. Borza turned to Eric and said, "Your sister is in good hands, Eric Sheppard."

"Thank you, Borza," Eric replied. "May I go in with her?"

"Of course you may. Had you simply walked in, no Maltorian would have stopped you." Turning to Margo, Borza said, "A team is standing by, Sorain, to implement the reversion procedures."

"Thank you, Overseer," Margo said. Turning to Eric, she said, "I will see you once I'm finished."

"I take it the reversion procedures will make you Maltorian again?"

"Yes." She ran a hand through her hair. "I've gotten used to having hair, but it will be good to see my own face in the mirror again."

Eric surprised them both by pulling her into a hug. "Thank you, Margo."

"You're welcome, Eric."

Eric and Margo parted ways, with him seeking out Olivia's bedside. He finally found her, in a setup that wouldn't have looked out of place on an episode of Star Trek. While she lay in bed, a team of medical professionals examined her, with not even her temperature being read by invasive means. When they were finished, the leader of the team said to Olivia, "All tests show the results we would expect of a Maltorian of your age, Olivia. There is nothing to indicate that you were born Terran."

"What happens now?" she asked.

"Now, we recommend rest. You have been through an experience unlike anything your people have done before." Turning to Eric, the doctor said, "Overseer Borza has provided you with temporary quarters, if you would like to get some rest, as well."

"Thank... thank you," Eric said. "Is there a place where I can gather my thoughts?"

"Of course," said another member of the medical team. "I will show you to the promenade."

Eric and Olivia exchanged a hug, and he followed the Maltorian woman out into the corridor and down to what looked like an elevator. Entering it, the Maltorian pressed a button with alien writing on it, and the elevator moved, first vertically, then horizontally.

When the lift came to a stop, it opened onto a large open area at the front of the ship. Eric saw alien trees and plants, as well as a number of ponds. The windows offered a spectacular view of both Earth and the moon. Spotting a bench, Eric said to the Maltorian, "Thank you for your help."

"You're welcome."

Eric made his way to the bench, glad to see that there was nobody else in the promenade. He wanted solitude.
1111111111111111111111111111111113111111.title: Aboard Ship

114.content:
The two were interrupted by a brilliant flash in the sky. They looked up to see a burning object fly passed just before a sonic boom rocked the area. A half second later, the object hit the ground with a thunderous boom, again shaking the ground. "What the heck was that?!" Shaken, Margo demanded.

"It had to have been a meteorite or something." Thoughtful, Liz said. She then smiled at Margo. "Come on, let's go check it out..."

"Are you nuts?!" Taken back, Margo demanded. "It's likely going to be super hot and more than likely left a huge hole in the ground."

"I didn't say we were going to touch it, scaredy-cat." Grinning, Liz said. "Come one, it'll be more fun than any movie we can go see."

Reluctantly, Margo followed Liz about a hundred yards to the crash sight where they found a sizeable hole about the size of a football stadium. At the bottom of the creator was the object in question but it was impossible for them to tell what it was from their vantage point. "Let's get a closer look before the cops come." Running into the creator, Liz said. "Are you coming or what?"

Margo sighed and, albeit reluctantly, followed Liz into the creator where they found the object was...
114.title: Something Else

1142.content:
It was a strange alien craft, Margo nor Liz had seen anything like it. The vessel, if you could call it that was the size of a freight cargo container but shaped like a giant sports car with wings. Liz, feeling no heat from the object reached out and touched it to Margo's horror. "It's as smooth as baby skin..." Softly, she said.

"You said you weren't going to touch it." Pulling her back, Margo scolded.

"Oh relax." Lightly, Liz said. "Nothing bad happened, see?"

As if on cue, a loud hiss was heard and a small seamless door on the ship, where Liz had touched, opened. Flashing lights and buzzers were heard inside but no obvious signs of anything moving within. "We need to get our of here..." Worried, Margo urged. "Who knows what is inside there and who knows what it will do upon seeing us."

"Or someone or something could be hurt." Serious, Liz countered.

"You are not seriously thinking of going in there, are you?" Frightened, Margo asked. "We have no idea what we will find in there or if whatever is in there is friendly."

Liz paused, only for a moment then...
1142.title: a strange alien craft.

11421.content:
Although very curious, common sense won out in the end and Margo reluctantly followed Liz back up the side of the creator. Only before they could even start climbing, they heard the sounds of several police and emergency response vehicles. Not wanting to be caught investigating the alien craft, the two girls panicked and ran back to the ship only to find themselves near the door just as multiple lights shined down upon them.

"You there!" Sternly, a man barked. "Freeze!"

Liz and Margo froze, for a moment then turned as someone was pulling onto the hem of their dresses. It was a small boy, curiously in a dress himself, motioning them to enter the vessel. "Curry..." anxious, he said. "De wok anger-us."

Strangely, Liz and Margo caught what the boy was saying and backed closer to the entrance to the alien craft. The lights remained fixed on them before one man shouted out, "Don't hurt them! They could have invaluable technology to share with us!"

Margo paused and looked up to find a short man with large round glasses standing at the edge of the creator. He wore black shoes, black pants and a white shirt and a white jacket over it all. Everything about him screamed doctor or scientist. "Welcome to Earth, noble travelers!" Smiling, he said. "We wish you no harm!"

"They think we're aliens..." Surprised, Margo whispered.

"Are they really that stupid?" Wincing, Liz whispered back.

"Lease... Curry!" Urgently, the boy called.

The small man adjusted his glasses then smiled. "There is a third female!" Excited, he called out. "Maybe we can isolate one of them!"

"Yup... they are that stupid." whispering, Margo whispered.

They turned to each other then...
11421.title: Awkward situation.

121.title: Character Profiles

info.brief_description: The citizens of a small town find themselves caught up in an alien invasion
info.description:
Note - this is a rebooted version of my story "The Invasion."

The residents of Redford, Pennsylvania find themselves caught up in an alien invasion. How will they survive?

Rules:
1. Use proper grammar
2. Be creative with storylines but keep close to the original idea.
3. Use the 3rd person perspective (he, she, he'll, etc) - as the story will be from multiple perspectives.
4. I reserve the right to edit, and/or/ remove chapters.
